story:
iLook

Few of us have the freedom to take a few minutes in a day to "Slow Down", and seriously "Look" at the visual landscape that surrounds us. Who has the time to digest the hundred's of thousands of images posted daily on Instagram? Almost no one.

iLook is an iPad and iPhone native App that solves that problem. Instead of more images, it's less. iLook filters the thousands of street art images posted daily, and actually lets you take the time to look and enjoy the most exciting visual imagery online today. iLook utilizes the Instagram API in building an online art gallery featuring 36 cities, allowing users to experience in glorious iPad resolution, the best of the world of contemporary street art.

Version 1.0 Features:
iPhone/iPad native applications
Save images to your camera roll
Full screen gallery views
GPS mapping and street art walks for 36 cities
Links back to Instagram original posts
Share images (Email, Facebook, Twitter)
Bookmark images, allowing to create your own art gallery

What We Need & What You Get

Beta .95 of iLook is complete. Six months of development time has already been invested. I'm seeking $5,000 to refine the App, to build out a marketing and media campaign, and to add the final features before submission to Apple's App store. What you get for your contribution is knowing that you are helping to bring the world's most exciting art onto a platform for everyone to download and enjoy. The guiding philosophy of iLook is that the best art in the world has been right in front of us all along, all we have to do is just "iLook" to see it.

Designers, architects, fashion mavens, UI/UX coders, and anyone involved in the creative media landscape will always find new and exciting sources of  inspiration daily. Nothing boring, I promise!

The Impact

My hope is that iLook will allow people to enjoy a true gallery experience with just a tap on their iPad. There are thousands of young artists today who may never get a chance to exhibit in a formal gallery space. iLook makes these invisible artists now truly visible.

With images tagged with GPS locations (built into the Instagram API), users will be able to build their own personal "Art Walks" with the initial roll out of 36 cities. I feel that artists and academic arts programs around the world will find this an innovative and exciting App.  Nothing is static, iLook delivers new images every time it's launched.


Risks & Challenges

100's of hours of iOS development time has been invested to bring iLook to where it is today. I am seeking funds to go live with with an updated iOS8 version for both iPad and iPhone. My challenge now is in completing the final programming on the V1.0 release, and developing a social media marketing campaign so that everyone can experience and discover new art and artists from around the world.

Other Ways You Can

Help Support Artists by taking a second to "Slow Down", and look at the world of art that surrounds us. All one has to do is open  their eyes, art is everywhere, just waiting to be discovered.

inspiration daily. Nothing boring, I promise!
  The Impact

My hope is that iLook will allow people to enjoy a true gallery 
experience with just a tap on their iPad. There are thousands of young 
artists today who may never get a chance to exhibit in a formal gallery space.
 iLook makes these invisible artists now truly visible. 
With images tagged with GPS locations (built into the Instagram API),
 users will be able to build their own personal "Art Walks" with the 
initial roll out of 36 cities. I feel that artists and academic arts programs around the world will find this an innovative and exciting App.  
Nothing is static, iLook delivers new images every time it's 
launched. 


  Risks & Challenges100's of hours
 of iOS development time has been invested to bring iLook to where it is today. I
 am seeking funds to go live with with an updated iOS8 version for both
iPad and iPhone. My challenge now is in completing the final programming on the V1.0 release, and developing a social media marketing campaign so that everyone can experience and discover new art and artists from around the world.
  Other Ways You Can 
Help Support Artists by taking a
 second to "Slow Down", and look at the world of art that surrounds us. 
All one has to do is open  their eyes, art is everywhere, just waiting to be discovered.

story:
Who is Quiltoni?

My name is Toni and I am a quilter.

Quilting has become a healthy obsession for me and  I love making people smile with my art.  As you can see in the video, my basement has been taken over by all of my fabric.  I search high and low everywhere I go in order to find the perfect fabrics for each project.

There is nothing like being at a convention and watching someone walk by, have them notice my booth, and have their face light up while they point to my quilt and smile.  I especially love the slack jawed amazement look.  One of my favorite moments was when a little boy walked by, pointed to my quilt and exclaimed, "Look Daddy, a Tardis!"

(Not a TARDIS, but an Enterprise!)

I specialize in geeky, video game, and comic quilts.  I will, of course, make any character or quilt you would like, but my favorites are the obscure ones that most people would not recognize unless they are a fan of that genre. Recently I've even begun making small custom drawstring bags (perfect for dice) and throw pillows in a large range of specialty fabrics to compliment my quilts.



So why do I need Indiegogo?

A few months ago I was robbed.


After finishing up a convention in my home town, I left everything in my trailer tightly secure and locked overnight.  When I awoke in the morning, it was all gone.  The only thing that remained were the metal grids I use to hang my quilts and my dollies.  Everything I had worked so hard and passionately on for months was gone in mere hours.  Insurance covered none of it.  I felt defeated, angry, and vulnerable, but even more determined to make my dream business a reality.

That is where you come in!

The Rewards


The Original NES Sampler Block Quilt


Want to see my gallery of quilts that I previously made to get an idea of what a commission would look like?  My website showcases a lot of them.  If you are thinking of a commission and want to make sure it is something I can do, feel free to ask first!

"But I want more than one reward!" you may say to yourself.  If this is you, change your pledge to the total of both rewards together (unless they are both limited rewards, you will need to pledge twice for those).  If both rewards require shipping, please make sure to include the cost of shipping for the second reward in your pledge.  At the end of the campaign, I will send a survey asking which rewards the pledge is to be used for.


Reward Goals!!

There are two main goals in the campaign.  If I am funded halfway I will reward everyone who has pledged at least $60 with a random dice bag.  If the campaign is funded at $10,000 everyone who has pledged $60 or more will receive a random dice bag and a dice bag of their choice for FREE!

'What about stretch goals?' I hear you ask.  I have thought long and hard about what I could offer on top of everything else that's already available and decided on bonus pillows, a job offer, and more opportunities to see the Phoenix Down quilt in person.



The Impact

Quilting as a whole is expensive.  Fabric and batting aren't cheap, even when I can get them on sale.  So 58% percent of the money raised goes to the materials for the making the quilts, pillows, and dice bags for your pledges.  13% of the money is for the fees and costs associated with the Indiegogo campaign.

So what am I doing with the 29% of the money I raise through this campaign?  I get back to where I was before the theft.  Luckily I am a fabric hoarder, so I still have a lot of fabric to work with.  I need a lot of the other basics that were stolen with my quilts: business cards, flyers, signage, a portable vacuum and storage bags for quilts and pillows, plastic totes to carry everything, etc.  If I raise more than what I need, I will use the money to attend extra conventions, hire some help (and provide local jobs) as well as some other really cool stretch goals.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks with this campaign because I will not accept any outside commissions for quilts until every single quilt, pillow, and dice bag is made from these contributions.

The largest challenge I will face is time management.  I am going to be 100% transparent with every quilt, pillow, and dice bag that is made and shipped out.  I have created this spreadsheet that will be updated with my progress daily on my website at www.quiltoni.com.  The quilts will be made in the order the money is pledged.  Your name (or pseudo name if it is a gift) and the progress I am making will always be visible.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who cannot financially help, please share this project with everyone you know!  Every view and share helps us towards reaching our goal.  Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or anywhere else you can!


Video Music courtesy of BenSound.

story:
"Study, find all the good teachers and study with them, get involved in acting to act, not to be famous or for the money. Do plays. It's not worth it if you are just in it for the money. You have to love it." - Philip Seymour Hoffman

Summary:

I'm Stephanie Jones, a Niagara resident, an actor, a playwright, and the Artistic Director of The Essential Collective Theatre.  I am also an acting teacher.  I love theatre and the craft of acting! I began teaching in my early twenties in the basement of the St. Catharines Soccer Club. I am unsure why it was called that, as there was no evidence of soccer being played there, but there was a large basement available, and it was there I first taught improvisation and improv games.  While guiding my students through the basics of improv and story-telling, I soon realized that they became more confident not only during the class session, but in their lives in general. I continued to act, teach and study for the next twenty years, and each of these roles fed and complimented each other.

In recent years, I taught Kindergarten to Grade 8 through Carousel Players Artist in the Classroom Program and presently, I am a part-time acting instructor at Niagara College. I have found one of the most rewarding tools to teach the serious actor (regardless of experience) is the Meisner technique. Although I enjoy all theatre art forms, I have a keen interest in text-based contemporary theatre, and this is the reason for also producing and creating theatre through ECT. Niagara and its artists are important to me, and to be able to teach Meisner technique within our region is a distinct asset.

In 2011, I was the recipient of an Ontario Arts Council Chalmers award in order to attend the Neighborhood Playhouse summer program and study Sanford Meisner’s repetition exercise.  The Neighborhood Playhouse has been a major force in theatre education since it's founding in 1928. This opportunity was to further my skills as an actor and also, to enable me to accurately implement the exercise into my teaching here in Niagara.   I soon discovered it was a skill that needed more time dedicated to it.  After six weeks of training, my previous experience as a performer and an acting instructor were a distinct asset, and I have been invited back to the Playhouse to receive a more detailed coaching experience from Ron Stetson, their senior instructor during January through to March 2013.

A Quote from Ron Stetson

"Sanford Meisner taught at The Playhouse for over 50 years. I personally trained under Mr. Meisner for many years. I have been teaching at the Playhouse for 30 years.  There is little room for misinterpretation on the technique itself.  Additionally, being able to study this technique at its official home is a unique opportunity and, I believe, of great benefit to her students.  Stephanie will have brought the information directly from the source. I applaud Stephanie for her intellectual and artistic integrity and I urge you to support her request."

Having searched for truth in my own work on stage, I discovered Meisner’s acting exercises and found them inspiring and completely practicable.  What was also compelling about the course of study was that the teacher participated in the activity when the student was not fully engaged in doing. This particular series of exercise needs a teacher who knows how to participate as an actor as well as an instructor.  Not since my previous study with Uta Hagen had I been so excited by the theatrical form I was witnessing within the classroom. I am excited to be able to introduce Niagara students to this course of study.

My expenses:

I am applying for a grant from the Canada Council for the Arts.  If successful, the grant will fund 70% of my expenses.  This campaign is to raise the other 30%.

  • Food
  • Travel
  • Subway pass
  • Rent
  • Canadian student visa

The Playhouse is charging an extremely small processing fee ($250) for my paper work.  Nice folks them guys.  The ability to raise the 30% of my funding through another source is looked upon favourably by the Canada Council jury.  My Canada Council application deadline is Sept. 15th 2012, and I aim to put this indiegogo campaign in my application.

I am determined to attend and follow through on the invitation.  I have every expectation that I will receive my grant, but we all know, it is never a sure thing.  My contingency plan if I do not receive my grant is to agreesively pimp out my husband...no, I will hold a high stakes poker game in my back-yard.

The Impact

The actor:

The ability to be fully present with your scene partner, and utilize text as an emotional connection that culminates in climax, is ongoing, and needs to be exercised, like any other physical pursuit.  Without exercise, the muscle relaxes and becomes weak.  Meisner created a unique series of exercises to work this theatrical muscle. The most basic exercise is the repetition exercise and it teaches the actor to be focused out on their partner while continuing to be in action.

Through the Theatre Company - Big Picture - Niagara big

The Essential Collective Theatre specializes in the creation and producing of contemporary, Canadian, text-based theatrical work.  We have produced many modern acclaimed playwrights as well as emerging Niagara writers.  These established Canadian playwrights have influenced our work and other Niagara playwrights, and they contain modern text that supports action-based representational performance.   Without a skilled actor to build upon the playwrights’ blueprint the theatrical picture is incomplete. I will offer classes through the theatre company on my return.

Me:

There is a special moment in the classroom when everything makes sense; the moment when an student actor drops pretense and tells the truth. When that happens the actor is nolonger self-conscious, nolonger trying to imitate, they are fully engaged in the action they are doing, and focused on their partner in the scene.  After that magic moment, the student actor realizes the power they have within themselves, they are what is riveting to watch.   They are enough.

I am thrilled to be offered this unique experience. 

"I regard the theatre as the greatest of all art forms, the most immediate way in which a human being can share with another the sense of what it is to be a human being." - Oscar Wilde

Like Mr. Wilde, I have seen the transformative qualities of "acting" and how it effects my students.  I want to offer the highest form of acting instruction, and I understand that that takes not only passion and understanding, but expereince and clarity. I can reach a new level of quality through my apprenticeship of Ron Stetson at The Neighborhood Playhouse.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find you can't contribute at this time, please spread the word, make some noise, and help me reach my goal.

Finally, a warm thank you for taking the time to review my campaign. 

"Be inspired, dare to dream big, never stop pushing yourself toward excellence." Me

story:
Quick Pitch:

The Red Gate Collective is applying to the City of Vancouver to lease their building at 281 Industrial Ave.  We need to raise as much money and support as we can to demonstrate that we have the organizational and financial means to be successful in this location. This is our chance to nail down a location for the next decade and do what we can to make Vancouver not suck. Sign our petition, become a member of our non-profit society, contact us about your space needs, donate!

Full details below:

Who We Are:

Last fall the Red Gate "Cultural Wildlife Refuge" lost its space in Vancouver's downtown eastside to the rising tide of redevelopment. In operation since 2004, the Red Gate was unique in the neighborhood, and the city, in both its longevity as a 100% self-funded and self-organized multi-purpose cultural facility, and in the depth and breadth of participation, collaboration, and support from a large user base that represented the broadest possible cross-section of amateur and professional artists, musicians, film-makers and photographers.

Its three floors and 15,000 square feet accommodated the JC/DC recording studio, home of the New Pornographers, Destroyer, and other internationally recognized recording artists, as well as providing affordable studio space for dozens of visual artists, rehearsal and performance space, an art gallery, flexible production facilities for large-format works, film and video production, movie screenings, community meeting space and more. All this made it one of the most well-used and well-loved cultural spaces in the city. Cost to the public: zero dollars. From the beginning we ran ourselves on a voluntary, collective, consensus basis with no outside funding or support of any kind, public or private.
For the last several years we were involved in complex negotiations between the City of Vancouver's Cultural Department, the Building Department, and the building's owner. In the end the owner decided to simply sell the building rather than undertake the complex and expensive repairs that would be required to keep the building open.

Since that time we've been hunting for a new home in the midst of Vancouver's over-priced real estate market. We found many suitable empty buildings, but they are expensive and subject to numerous bylaw, zoning, and allowable use restrictions. Last february we discovered an empty City-owned building at 281 Industrial Avenue in the centrally-located False Creek flats area, and made a proposal to the City to lease the building. We received an immediate response stating that a resolution would shortly be brought to Council to deal with the issue of vanishing cultural space, by directing City staff to identify City-owned buildings which could be leased to arts groups "on a cost-recovery basis". We welcomed this news and waited patiently for the promised "request for proposals" for the Industrial Ave. space, which finally arrived at the end of July.

What We're Trying To Do:

We're currently working on a group proposal with some other displaced artists and creators: deadline for submissions is the end of August. We're seeking collaborators and supporters - if you're looking for space, please direct expressions of interest to redgate@at.org - if you want to help us send a message to the City that we're the best group to operate this building, read on.

In order to secure this space, we will need to demonstrate to the City that we have the  support of the community, and the organizational and financial means to pay the basic rent and expenses, and to undertake any necessary upgrades to the space beyond the basic structure. It's a big space: around 15,000 square feet on the main floor, and another 2500 square feet of office space on the second floor.

It's a lot of space, and at the proposed lease rate of $7.50 per square foot per year, it will cost a lot of money; somewhere in the neighborhood of $12,000 per month including utilities. We're putting in a joint proposal with two other non-profit organizations, involved in the vibrant and forward-looking "maker" movement, currently pioneering a high-tech do-it-yourself ethos. The Vancouver Hack Space and the Vancouver Community Laboratory have collaborated recently on several successful "Maker Faires" which have been well-received by the media and by the city as a whole. This partnership will serve to offset our space requirements and financial committments, but beyond this we think culture comprises much more, and is more important, than the narrowly-defined "fine arts" - we think everyone is, or can be, an artist, and that true creativity exists in all walks of life. We feel that new ideas and new approaches are required now more than ever, in this age of global economic and ecological crises. Experience and history shows that new modes and concepts grow out of the encounters, often unplanned, between previously separate domains of culture. The downtown eastside has historically provided a reservoir of old and inexpensive buildings in which this cross-fertilization of experimental culture could take place, but the recent rapid increase in real estate values has forced such marginal activities elsewhere. The Red Gate's sister studio, directly across the street from our former location, has until the end of August to vacate their 15,000 square foot space; we're also partnering with many of these "renoviction" refugees in our proposal to the City.

Rather than complain about this state of affairs, we want to do something about it. Rather than join the ragged retreat to more "artist friendly" cities like Montreal, Detroit, or Berlin (as many of our friends and colleagues have already done) we intend to re-group, dig in, and do what we can to make Vancouver not suck, to open a new front in the long battle against the stigma of "No Fun City". If we don't get this building, we'll find another; there's plenty of empty buildings around town, this one is just particularly well-located, and at the low end of the price scale.

Our Vision

We want to create a space that fosters the widest possible range of collaborative, creative activity. We see culture in the broadest sense as the apex of human expressions and aspirations, the root from which all branches of human activity grow; the sum of all the stories we tell ourselves and each other about who we are and what we're doing. Culture is often considered narrowly as a somewhat marginal and impractical activity, somewhere down the "hierarchy of needs" to be enjoyed only after our real, practical tasks are accomplished. we think that culture is the reason we do all the other stuff. There's nothing more practical than having a reason to get out of bed in the morning.

Culture in this broader sense is always an organic synthesis of technical, aesthetic, and social elements. Therefore we see any functioning cultural space as requiring zones for these three overlapping spheres of activity. Accordingly, we intend to partition the building into areas set aside for the advancement of these three elements of culture, with the social element providing the crucial role in integrating the technical and the aesthetic. Some areas will be reserved for workshops devoted to a wide range of technologies, from wood and metal working to electronics, 3D printing and fabrication, and software/interface design and development, to be managed and operated by the VHS and VCL collectives. A large portion will be dedicated to artist studios and rehearsal space for visual and performing artists, with a mix of shared and private space. And a significant portion will be set aside for common areas and space for special events, exhibitions, performances, and other socially-oriented activities that will be accessible to the general public, as well as providing options for short-term production space for film/video/photographic projects, construction or assembly of large-format art works, meetings and seminars, and other activities that may require a fairly large open space for short periods of time.

The most important function will be to provide this space at rates which are affordable to low-income artists and creators; for us this means less than one dollar per square foot per month. In addition to this we intend to develop any and all means to present and promote the output and activity of our members and tenants, via public exhibitions as well as a weekly webcast showcasing the ideas and projects under development. We think that there is a lot of amazing work being done in Vancouver that is not widely recognized or understood, and we hope to do what we can to change this.

How You Can Help

If you want to see the Red Gate rise again, here's what you can do to help. We're actively seeking collaborators and supporters - artists, musicians, photographers, film-makers and others who want to get in on the ground floor. We want to raise as much money as we can, in order to prove to the City that we mean business, and that we have broad support in the community. If you need space and want to get involved, please contact us at redgate@at.org. If you want to support us in other ways, please consider a buying a membership or making a donation, and please pass along this appeal to your friends, families, and associates. See the list of "rewards" we are offering for various contributions. If we don't succeed in obtaining this particular building, we'll find another, so you don't have to worry about your efforts going to waste, one way or another we're going to do this. Now is the time to reverse the trend of vanishing cultural habitat and to build something amazing together!

Who We Are:

Last fall the Red Gate "Cultural Wildlife Refuge" lost its space in Vancouver's downtown eastside to the rising tide of redevelopment. In operation since 2004, the Red Gate was unique in the neighborhood, and the city, in both its longevity as a 100% self-funded and self-organized multi-purpose cultural facility, and in the depth and breadth of participation, collaboration, and support from a large user base that represented the broadest possible cross-section of amateur and professional artists, musicians, film-makers and photographers.
Its three floors and 15,000 square feet accommodated the JC/DC recording studio, home of the New Pornographers, Destroyer, and other internationally recognized recording artists,  as well as providing affordable studio space for dozens of visual artists, rehearsal and performance space, an art gallery, flexible production facilities for large-format works, film and video production, movie screenings, community meeting space and more. All this made it one of the most well-used and well-loved cultural spaces in the city. Cost to the public: zero dollars. From the beginning we ran ourselves on a voluntary, collective, consensus basis with no outside funding or support of any kind, public or private.For the last several years we were involved in complex negotiations between the City of Vancouver's Cultural Department, the Building Department, and the building's owner. In the end the owner decided to simply sell the building rather than undertake the complex and expensive repairs that would be required to keep the building open.Since that time we've been hunting for a new home in the midst of Vancouver's over-priced real estate market. We found many suitable empty buildings, but they are expensive and subject to numerous bylaw, zoning, and allowable use restrictions. Last february we discovered an empty City-owned building at 281 Industrial Avenue in the centrally-located False Creek flats area, and made a proposal to the City to lease the building. We received an immediate response stating that a resolution would shortly be brought to Council to deal with the issue of vanishing cultural space, by directing City staff to identify City-owned buildings which could be leased to arts groups "on a cost-recovery basis". We welcomed this news and waited patiently for the promised "request for proposals" for the Industrial Ave. space, which finally arrived at the end of July.
What We're Trying To Do:
We're currently working on a group proposal with some other displaced artists and creators: deadline for submissions is the end of August. We're seeking collaborators and supporters - if you're looking for space, please direct expressions of interest to redgate@at.org - if you want to help us send a message to the City that we're the best group to operate this building, read on.

In order to secure this space, we will need to demonstrate to the City that we have the  support of the community, and the organizational and financial means to pay the basic rent and expenses, and to undertake any necessary upgrades to the space beyond the basic structure. It's a big space: around 15,000 square feet on the main floor, and another 2500 square feet of office space on the second floor.

It's a lot of space, and at the proposed lease rate of $7.50 per square foot per year, it will cost a lot of money; somewhere in the neighborhood of $12,000 per month including utilities. We're putting in a joint proposal with two other non-profit organizations, involved in the vibrant and forward-looking "maker" movement, currently pioneering a high-tech do-it-yourself ethos. The Vancouver Hack Space and the Vancouver Community Laboratory have collaborated recently on several successful "Maker Faires" which have been well-received by the media and by the city as a whole. This partnership will serve to offset our space requirements and financial committments, but beyond this we think culture comprises much more, and is more important, than the narrowly-defined "fine arts" - we think everyone is, or can be, an artist, and that true creativity exists in all walks of life. We feel that new ideas and new approaches are required now more than ever, in this age of global economic and ecological crises. Experience and history shows that new modes and concepts grow out of the encounters, often unplanned, between previously separate domains of culture. The downtown eastside has historically provided a reservoir of old and inexpensive buildings in which this cross-fertilization of experimental culture could take place, but the recent rapid increase in real estate values has forced such marginal activities elsewhere. The Red Gate's sister studio, directly across the street from our former location, has until the end of August to vacate their 15,000 square foot space; we're also partnering with many of these "renoviction" refugees in our proposal to the City.

Rather than complain about this state of affairs, we want to do something about it. Rather than join the ragged retreat to more "artist friendly" cities like Montreal, Detroit, or Berlin (as many of our friends and colleagues have already done) we intend to re-group, dig in, and do what we can to make Vancouver not suck, to open a new front in the long battle against the stigma of "No Fun City". If we don't get this building, we'll find another; there's plenty of empty buildings around town, this one is just particularly well-located, and at the low end of the price scale.
Our Vision
We want to create a space that fosters the widest possible range of collaborative, creative activity. We see culture in the broadest sense as the apex of human expressions and aspirations, the root from which all branches of human activity grow; the sum of all the stories we tell ourselves and each other about who we are and what we're doing. Culture is often considered narrowly as a somewhat marginal and impractical activity, somewhere down the "hierarchy of needs" to be enjoyed only after our real, practical tasks are accomplished. we think that culture is the reason we do all the other stuff. There's nothing more practical than having a reason to get out of bed in the morning. Culture in this broader sense is always an organic synthesis of technical, aesthetic, and social elements. Therefore we see any functioning cultural space as requiring zones for these three overlapping spheres of activity. Accordingly, we intend to partition the building into areas set aside for the advancement of these three elements of culture, with the social element providing the crucial role in integrating the technical and the aesthetic. Some areas will be reserved for workshops devoted to a wide range of technologies, from wood and metal working to electronics, 3D printing and fabrication, and software/interface design and development, to be managed and operated by the VHS and VCL collectives. A large portion will be dedicated to artist studios and rehearsal space for visual and performing artists, with a mix of shared and private space. And a significant portion will be set aside for common areas and space for special events, exhibitions, performances, and other socially-oriented activities that will be accessible to the general public, as well as providing options for short-term production space for film/video/photographic projects, construction or assembly of large-format art works, meetings and seminars, and other activities that may require a fairly large open space for short periods of time.The most important function will be to provide this space at rates which are affordable to low-income artists and creators; for us this means less than one dollar per square foot per month. In addition to this we intend to develop any and all means to present and promote the output and activity of our members and tenants, via public exhibitions as well as a weekly webcast showcasing the ideas and projects under development. We think that there is a lot of amazing work being done in Vancouver that is not widely recognized or understood, and we hope to do what we can to change this.
How You Can Help
If you want to see the Red Gate rise again, here's what you can do to help. We're actively seeking collaborators and supporters - artists, musicians, photographers, film-makers and others who want to get in on the ground floor. We want to raise as much money as we can, in order to prove to the City that we mean business, and that we have broad support in the community. If you need space and want to get involved, please contact us at redgate@at.org. If you want to support us in other ways, please consider a buying a membership or making a donation, and please pass along this appeal to your friends, families, and associates. See the list of "rewards" we are offering for various contributions. If we don't succeed in obtaining this particular building, we'll find another, so you don't have to worry about your efforts going to waste, one way or another we're going to do this. Now is the time to reverse the trend of vanishing cultural habitat and to build something amazing together!

story:
1/15/2012 Only 5 days left - Additional Incentive
Artist Bryce Merlin is donating a "Fast Food" cup with his art work for the first person to donate $40


And for the first person to donate $100 An "Angel" Sigg Water Bottle.  Thank you Bryce.
see www.facebook.com/theartofautism for image

1/13/2012   ONLY SIX DAYS LEFT
AN ADDITIONAL INCENTIVE - for the next 12 people who donate $10 or more you will receive a beautiful 2012 Eco-Art Calendar with different images each month by Eco-Artist GRANT MANIER - Thank you Grant Manier from Houston! See the Updates for a sample of his art & Thank all who have emailed and called with offers of help!

"Educators need to spend more time developing a child's area of strength and less time pounding away on the deficits." Temple Grandin

Raising $11,000 for "THE ART OF AUTISM"

Our goal of $11,000 will print the 2012 edition of the full-color Art of Autism book and offset costs for the live, theatrical and art installation events scheduled in 2012. 

Be a Part of the Art!  Build futures and grow careers with people on the autism spectrum.


The ART of AUTISM is a project that incorporates The ART of AUTISM book, art shows, live theatrical entertainment events, workshops, and films to shift consciousness and awareness regarding autism. We are committed to promoting talented artists on the autism spectrum and educating the general public. We support artists through mentorship, building resumes, portfolios, and direct work experience. Participants in past events report an improvement in self-esteem, executive functioning skills, media exposure and often a sense of community that they have never experienced before. Most importantly, they make friends and lifelong connections. The majority of money raised from the Art of Autism art sales goes directly to the artist. A portion also goes to a local nonprofit who hosts the show.



Linda Gund Anderson, Celebrate Autism, presenting a painting of a cow by Kevin Hosseini to Dr. Temple Grandin in November 2011.


The Autism Shift: Shifting Consciousness

People on the spectrum often internalize the negative messages broadcast on the media. We provide an alternative to those messages; focusing on the positive aspects of autism.
 
Joanne Lara and her Autism Movement Dancers at the ARTof AUTISM Hollywood California May 2011. Joanne is a collaborator in our project.

The ART of AUTISM is a collaborative of 23 like-minded organizations, 80+ artists, 20+ poets and authors, and 100+ entertainers and growing. Role models on the spectrum in our collaborative include Dr. Temple Grandin, Dr. Stephen Shore, Dr. Michael McManmon, and Donna Williams.


The ART of AUTISM at the Good Purpose Gallery in The Berkshires, November 2011

Testimonials

 "The Good Purpose Gallery was set up to show the work of professional artists throughout the year including professional artists who are on the Spectrum.  We recently tied a one person show of Esther Brokaw's (savant, autistic artist) in with a showing of student work from our young adults who have Asperger's Syndrome and Learning Differences.  That lead to creating a dual fundraiser 3 day event with the Art of Autism at the end of the show.  The show was heart warming and people asked specifically for us to bring it back for a longer length of time. This idea led to the creating of two additional gallery spaces near the main gallery that will show the art of artists on the spectrum in rotating 6 week segments, 7 days a week, year round.  Getting us totally on mission of providing visual arts opportunities to those on the autism spectrum."
Francine Britton, The Good Purpose Gallery, Lee, Massachusetts.

"The Art of Autism helped Justin meet some key people at Disney Studios and as a result a mentorship developed for Justin!" Maria Teresa Canha, mom to illustrator Justin Canha

Turning Gifts Into Action




The ART of AUTISM has had art shows since 2005. In 2011 we went international debuting five major shows in the U.S. and Canada. In 2012 we are planning many more. Funding will support the publication of ï¿½The ART of AUTISM: 2012 Edition,ï¿½ featuring more art, 35 more artists, and poetry. Essayists in the new edition of the book include Dr. Darold Treffert (expert on savant syndrome), Dr. Stephen Shore (author and international speaker),  Dr. Colin Zimbleman (depth psychologist and expert on autism), Dr. Rebecca McKenzie (Psychologist and expert on autism), Elaine Hall (founder of The Miracle Project), Keri Bowers (Film maker and international speaker), and Debra Hosseini (author and art curator).

The book is a tool to be used by contributors to promote their work in commerce, social, and other media. Our goal of $11,000 will print the book ($7,000), and ($4,000) to assist with expenses of art and entertainment shows in 2012. When the book is complete, each contributing artist, poet, and essayist will receive a free copy of the book and the opportunity to purchase additional books at a reduced cost (if we receive funding for this project).In 2012, we are planning:

ï¿½         Houston, TX      Nashville, TN      Various locations in California    Israel   ????

Details and collaborators will be posted on our website - www.the-art-of-autism.com. If youï¿½d like to be involved in one of these locations or add your own, see levels of giving. Weï¿½d love to come to your town and create the magic of the ART of AUTISM.

story:
PLEASE NOTE: IF YOU HAVE A PAYPAL ACCOUNT, PLEASE DONATE BY DOING A BANK TRANSFER, NOT A CARD PAYMENT FROM YOUR PAYPAL ACCOUNT TO MINE - THERE IS FEE IF YOU PAY BY CARD THROUGH PAYPAL. PART OF YOUR DONATION WILL BE DEDUCTED BY PAYPAL IF YOU DONATE THROUGH A DEBIT OR CREDIT CARD SO YOU'RE DONATING LESS THAN YOU THINK. THANKS!

Also if you know me well and are happy to, you can transfer the money directly to my bank account and then there will be no IndieGoGo fees either.

Short Summary

I'm running the Glasgow Women's 10k in May. As someone who can barely run the length of herself, this is going to be TOUGH.

I initially decided to run the 10k as a challenge to raise money for my theatre company's visit to the Prague Fringe in May. However, I've decided I want to split that money between the production and a charity - which in this case will be Rape Crisis Scotland. 

Makeshift Broadcast, the theatre company, needs money to fund flights and accommodation as well as paying for production costs. This is a great opportunity for us to showcase work abroad.

I'm using IndieGoGo as I can't use other fundraising sites when our company are not a registered charity - I will forward the money to Rape Crisis Scotland myself and have already made contact with them.

Donations

The £500 goal may seem high for a 10k but I've chosen the option where any funds raised by a certain date get saved rather than being returned to those donating as my project can be completed without hitting the target.

Any donation you make will be divided equally between my project and Rape Crisis Scotland.

More Information

You can find out more about Makeshift Broadcast here:

makeshiftbroadcast.wordpress.com
@mkshftbrdcst
https://www.facebook.com/makeshiftbroadcast

Please look into the amazing work Rape Crisis Scotland do too:
http://www.rapecrisisscotland.org.uk/

I will be blogging my progress at:

http://kathruns10k.blogspot.co.uk/

story:
Here's some background info for you:

  • My name is Nicole Louw and I am a junior in high school.
  • I am an artist hoping to pursue a career in animation.
  • CalArts has a summer program for young animators and going would help me greatly build a portfolio.
  • The top animators in the industry will be there and teach along with reviewing sketchbooks and portfolios
  • It is gonna cost a really scary $6500 for everything and I don't have that 
  • I need this course desperately  if I want to build a good enough portfolio, getting my name out there, and I would have big enough scholarship opportunities to make it into CalArts after high school.

(perks are cumulative so every tier includes all the items available through the lower tiers)


$5 Perks: Card!


At this level you will receive one of these lovely cards in the mail. You get to specify which one you want and these 5" x 7" cards are sure to show you just how grateful I am for the donation!


$10 Perks: Mini Prints!

Here I will send you five postcard sized prints in the mail! I am going to have a whole lot of artwork up for you to choose from, and if you know my art you can request any pieces I may have forgotten!



$25 Perks: Button!


This level's rewards is one of these awesome buttons. Who doesn't love buttons? You get to specify which one you'd like and I will send it with lots of love.



 $75 Perks: Temporary Tattoos and Stickers!


You can have any three of these as temporary tattoos and three as stickers!! You can pick the same designs or different ones it's totally up to you! 



$100 Perks: Sketch Book!

                          

Some Examples of Artwork That Will Appear:


This is a really cool perk! For a donation of $100, you will receive a copy of a compilation of my favorite sketches and drawings from my actual sketchbooks.



$150 Perks: DVD!

  

At this level I will send you a DVD filled with lessons, speedpaints, and tips and tricks that I like to use in my art!



$250 Perks: Large Print!


This tier gets you one large (16"x20") high-quality print of my artwork. You will have a lot of choices to pick from.



$350 Perks: Two Large Prints!

    

This tier gets you not one, but two large (16"x20") high-quality prints of my artwork. You will have a lot of choices to pick from, so don't worry!



What happens if this campaign raises more than the goal?

  • First and foremost, I will use the extra money to counterbalance the cost of all of the rewards I send out and the fees and taxes of everything.
    • Realistically, if I want to pay for all of it in one go, this campaign will have to raise some $10,000+ because of taxes
  • If it raises more money after that then I will make extra goodies and rewards!


I have a special reward for people that share this campaign and get others to donate!

If you share this campaign with someone and that person donates and then messages me here with your name, both of you will be entered to win an exclusive original piece of work, other extra works exclusive to this reward tier of the program,  and lots of extra goodies! The more people that donate and give me your name, the more times you are entered!

story:
If you are seeing this, it’s because I really really trust you. I know that no one has any money, least of all you; much less money to throw at something so first-world and comfy as what I am about to propose, but if anyone here loves PHIL KING even a fraction as much as I do and can afford to throw a few bucks at this “problem” it would be wonderful and make him extremely happy and contribute to his overall well-being.

FACT : Phil is a Pisces with his Moon in Libra. What this means is that his birthday is coming up. 

Phil is a devoted father with a teenaged daughter and is currently living in England as circumstances have made it necessary that he homeschool her. (I'm not uploading a picture of her here as she is a child, but Phil has pictures of her on the facebook). As such he is trying to piece together a modest income writing articles about art and doing translation work. Alas, last week his only laptop was broken (not by him), making it necessary that he do all his writing on an older iPad given to him by his father. As many of you are academics with iPads, you know this is impractical and sad – today he couldn’t even get the wireless printer to work with the iPad.

I would like to get Phil a laptop that he can actually depend on, which he can use to do his work while helping his child. I think he’s pretty amazing to be so devoted. Alas, I am fairly broke as well, though I will be contributing as much as I can to this present.

I will spend 100% of anything you give to buy the best possible computer I can find, whether that means an older but functioning computer covered with Black Sabbath stickers off the Craigslist, or a brand new state-of-the-art piece of reverse engineered alien technology.

I know that many of you know Phil and are friends with him, so even if all you would ever do for him is buy him a burrito, it would be cool if you put the burrito money towards this present. Maybe you would buy him a bottle of Veuve Clicquot or a small chicken-shaped cookie jar… You could put that money towards this as well.

I use a laser engraver where I work; if you contribute to this gift, I will laser-engrave your name and anything you might wish to say to Phil on the computer and send it to him for his birthday.  That way he will always know how many people truly love him.

If you share this, please hide your post from Phil, his family, and any friends you suspect might tell Phil or his family. I want it to be a surprise.

Thanks so much in advance. I know it is a lot to ask when so many people are suffering in so many different ways, but I really know in my heart that it would mean the world to him.


Love, joni

impractical and sad – today he couldn’t even get the wireless printer to work
with the iPad.
I would like to get Phil a laptop that he can actually depend on, which he can
use to do his work while helping his child. I think he’s pretty amazing to be
so devoted. Alas, I am fairly broke as well, though I will be contributing as
much as I can to this present.
I will spend 100% of anything you give to buy the best possible computer I can
find, whether that means an older but functioning computer covered with Black
Sabbath stickers off the Craigslist, or a brand new state-of-the-art piece of
reverse engineered alien technology.
I know that many of you know Phil and are friends with him, so even if all you
would ever do for him is buy him a burrito, it would be cool if you put the
burrito money towards this present. Maybe you would buy him a bottle of Veuve
Clicquot or a small chicken-shaped cookie jar… You could put that money towards
this as well.
I use a laser engraver where I work; if you contribute to this gift, I will
laser-engrave your name and anything you might wish to say to Phil on the
computer and send it to him for his birthday. 
That way he will always know how many people truly love him. 
If you share this, please hide your post from Phil, his family, and any friends
you suspect might tell Phil or his family. I want it to be a surprise. 
Thanks so much in advance. I know it is a lot to ask when so many people are
suffering in so many different ways, but I really know in my heart that it
would mean the world to him.

Love, joni

story:
Update 7.11.2014 (11/7/14):

Today we´re having an appointment at our fine-art print service provider, to get your perks printed. 

Next week we´ll start to ship them, but keep you informed with the exact date!

Have great weekend - it´s freezing in Germany - and all the best, yours, 

Sascha Hojzakowa | Jack the Flipper  

Atelier Fanpage @ Facebook

UPDATE:

Thank you all for your support dear friends/backers. 

We managed to get it done. The Atelier/Studio Room has been left in it´s old industrial charme and we fitted it out with "cool daylight" and a big board (9x6ft|3x2m) and started creating our first large scale stunning India Ink painting. 

The Showroom is done as well. We got the flooring for a steal and applyed it our selves with help of a lady friend, the flooring looks awesome. The room & doors, entrance and roof have been painted 3-5 times to get a pristine clean atmosphere for displaying our works. On the ceiling I installed a stunning lighting system we bought. It runs on LED´s and the color temperature is "warm daylight", it highlights everything perfectly and is easy to handle.

Our Office has been the first remodelled room, we some pieces of furniture a repeater and printer, everything is in it´s place by now.

"Tony" our Studio/Atelier cat is enjoying the human company and constant petting, at night he sleeps inside and by day he´s on the "hunt" though our neighbor´s gardens.

We launched a FB Studio/Atelier page and document everything here!

Thank you again for your kind support & sharing of our journey, we are driven, more than every and will reach our goal. Stay tuned and befriend us to be on track with us. Best regards, 

yours Sascha Hojzakowa | Jack the Flipper | Artwork & Photography

_____________________________________________________________________________

"I make a difference here by being 100% honest & transparent & offer exceptional collectible perks!" Sascha Hojzakowa | JtF

Hier für DEUTSCH klicken - Spenden bitte über Indiegogo - German translation :)

Jack the Flipper - Background 

"Jack the Flipper | Artwork & Photography" evolved from a deep friendship and a deeper understanding of fine-arts. Back in 2011 I (Sascha Hojzakowa) owned a store (with my BF) and Markus Brungs - he´s got a fine arts masters degree - was a customer.

We started talking about both our passion photography, one thing let to another, so we spent the whole winter 2011-12 in the basement and started to shoot waterdrops. In the end we had built a professional waterdrop studio and took +10.000 pictures. Every single sculpture was different - I can tell you!

Impossible to reproduce - shot in a 10.000th of a second. 

The obvious may hide an awesome spectacle - who knew - until JtF comes a long and unravels it. Flash yourself with our "discovery" - the visual impact is sensational: 

  

"Tutelum"                                  "Aquanoxi Dancer"               "Columna"

"Aqua Momentum" we called this scientific series. 6 motifs are in this Edition. 


  

"Umbella"                                  "Diadema"                                "Achtfugit"


We where more than impressed by the results we got from hundreds of hours of experimenting and shooting these sculptures. It was a huge scientific project combined with our artistic vision of unraveling the mystery - uncapable for the human eye to observe - of such a common thing (to us industrialized nations) like water. In this case Waterdrops. 

Often the precious things lie directly in front of you, but if you look closely you can make it visible.

These are 100% photographys, no digital manipulation at all. 

Below "Making of Aqua Momentum" - The device imported from US: StopShot

 


I feel to get personal for 2 mins to honor my nana

My BF and I spent 6,5y of our lives every day (6d/12h) to keep our store running & to make the customers happy.....we somehow lost ourselves on the way. In 2012 we had to sell our store due to worse getting burnout sympthoms. I got cardiac arrhythmia, insomnia & lost 50p. Uwe (my BF) got a ping-pong-ball size tumor, right under his ear in the salivary gland. 

When he had to stay in the hospital (3 weeks), I couldn´t visit him just once because I had to run our business (aftermath: half his face including one ear is completely numb). Since december 2013 we are struggling financially. The buyer of our store isn´t paying the monthly rates anymore and already resold "our" business.

Without my nana - born christmas eve 1922 - we (Uwe & Me) would be lost, she´s financing our lives with her pension. She prays for us everyday and deeply believes in our enterprise. All this wouldn´t be possible without her. She hardly survived the dark nazi times,  I love you Nana!

  Thats her & me (Sascha) 

You play the most important role to help us prospering. Its a timely matter.

The Logo - 100% soul 

The conception & creation of our logo took us 3 weeks and you´ll see, it was totally worth it, it combines everything we are. Before rendering it had 177 photoshop layers and was 2,7gb large. We put 100% of our soul & love into everything we create!


+67.000€ we invested until today in living expenses, equipment, photo projects, health insurance and printing our works and keep it all running. Yes €, not $. (most part on Markus, he owns all the equipment) 

Each accomplishment, we created/reached by ourselves, e.g. Logos, layout, design, post production, publishing, public relations, etc. 

However our clock is ticking, we maxed out our budget and by the end of the year we have to earn money. Or we will loose everything. Even our home. Seriously.

There is our plain & structured website, blog & social media with published new works nourished daily with stunning accompanying texts by Uwe (top expert).

The composition & development (of our works) account for our backgound as classical studied painters, regard the classical definition of fine-arts.  

                 

Paris 2 | France                                                        Le Mont Saint Michel 5 | France

Eastbourne Grand Pier 2 | England

Dyrhólaey Seaside 1 | Iceland (blue hour at it´s finest - see more...)

Godafoss Herd of Horses 1 | Iceland (by fluke this herd passed by - see more...)


Yoda says: "Social Proof you have"


All online stuff we have fulfilled so far, Uwe nurses daily (flickr, g+, FB, instagram, 500px, fotocommunity, blog, homepage, shop and answering every question)

The social media feedback we receive is overwhelming.

+2.000.000 hits on our G+ must mean we have social proof!

 

De Val 1 | Netherlands (G+)  +478               Flower 37 | Flower (tumblr) +1041


Our "425.000$" Online Shop - I´m not kidding

And that isn´t fairly enough... Do the math friends. The daily rate of a newcomer photographer is (890€) 1180$, we are far beyond that, as you observed.  We worked 6 months to realize our design concept, capture all the pictures and fulfill all the business administration. That´ll add up to 424.800$. Wooooow.

Another calculation example: Below is a productphoto we shot for our online shop. 24 motifs we finalized - each captured with 220-300 different settings - that´s ± 5300 pictures we created, multiply them by let´s say 40$ each (incl. Studio, post processing) = 212.000$. Again. Wooooooooow.

You see, it isn´t really easy to put that in numbers.  It was our artistic vision. We wanted to create a shop where we spend our money. You can see, that we thought every part of it through. 

It´s the realization of our vision, we dedicated all our heart & soul into this project. What do you think? 

"Jökulsárlón Seaside 2 | 2013 - Living Room Example from JtF-Shop" -  http://jacktheflipper-shop.com

During this product shot the ice kept melting and melting, turning everything into a constant mess.  We mopped up the water to get the set pristine again and again, and....we wanted to reflect the feeling of ICELAND :-)

So far we have created nearly 8 TB of data for "Jack the Flipper", this split up into +33.000 files organized in +22.000 folders. I told you, every itsy-bitsy mosaic piece WE created. 

You see, we are pushing ourselves or are we going insane? Hahaha... :)


Jack the Flipper - Offline World

"Jack the Flipper" is an officially licensed business in the offline world, too.

In an upscale hairsalon we´re already on display with 10 of our works +10 ready to frame archival prints in a display (see below), this investment alone was 1175$ for us.

 

Above: Printing (Canon IPF 9400 - 12 inks!) & Preparing the COA for each work

Below: Stamping & sealing off our framed works & the 10 finished ones

 

 

Above: Our works @ Fine Hairdressing Salon "Abschnitt"


We don´t trust the system - so let´s hack it :) 

We worked with galerists etc., but we don´t trust the "old" system, we want to hack it - thanks Timothy Ferriss :)  Rely on yourself. So do we.


 Markus & Sascha

We are proud. We follow our vision. We work hard. Do you see we are driven?!

Art Cologne | Fine arts market proof - we got!

Before JtF - when Markus created unique fine-art works - he sold +12 paintings (5.000€ & up). One was sold even before "ArtCologne 2006" opened for 6.500€. "The World our Dream | 2007" took a month to create and has never been offered for sale - it reflects the profound understanding of Markus in technique and creativity. It´s 3D painted in oil-on-chalk-on-canvas-on-wood, he has been taught this craft by his Prof. Nikolaj Fedkovic who sold these apiece for high five-figures. Since this was 8 years ago - everyone forgot. 

Starting in late September 2014 we´ll create large scale artworks in our Atelier.

This gets us back on the art market and our Perks become valuable collectibles. Promised!

Below: Markus Brungs creating "The World our Dream | 2007" inspired from the correspondant poem by Hermann Hesse

 

Above: Markus working on the intricate details of this masterpiece                      Below: Most early step - creating the 3D chalk letters to "write" the poem onto 

 

Above: Coloring the 3D letters - can you read the poem - it´s in german :)

Above: final work "The World our Dream |  2007" - the whole work is in 3D - but the effect is hardly visible on these photos.


"Venice | Markus Brungs | 2002" Edition of 15 motifs painted in India ink and acrylic paint - digital scans of original fine-art works - selection of 5 below 

There is so much more to tell about us....but I have to cut to the chase. 


Project - Atelier - Background

We require an Atelier | Studio. We need to shake the market with our works. We have to act. You play the crucial part here dear backers. Please act now. 
The place has an industrial character and huge potential to start our offline enterprise, it´s about 700sq.ft, however it needs urgent remodelling. We got the keys and already started with heavy cleaning, preparations and painting. 
What can you do there?
  • creative workspace for Markus, Uwe & Sascha
  • create new Artworks again (century old skillful techniques which we master)
  • starting late September with a new Edition of large scale Artworks
  • execute new scientific photo projects 
  • host accompanying workshops
  • picture framing services
  • free workshops & events for the not so fortunate (req. washing room/see stretch goals) 
  • host Art Dinners with local bands/DJ´s (req. washing room)
  • hold competitions
  • offer Internships for students (req. washing room)
  • encounter with you & show our works
  • see workflow, insights and backgrounds of our world
  • share our knowledge & we boost your skills
  • explain our equipment
  • the place where you can pet our atelier cat "Tony" :)

You can put us on the map and make us real. You only have the force!

Your support is vital to the success of this campaign, we take every risk to realize our venture, we know our strengths, we´ve worked so much and won´t back down. Never. 
We follow our dream & passion and you be the crucial part, our funding-fathers. 

Big Inspirer

Peter Lik is a legend! He´s an big inspirer and a self made man. That´s what we adore about him. He´s living proof. We have a lot in common - apart from him already beeing on the summit. Just follow your path. You can only be free, if you free yourself from contraints put on you by others. 

Every progress we´ll document every on our social-media profiles. 

Further assurance for YOU: Our business ia laywered up by Thoms & Hugl

"Tony" the abandoned cat  

He was left behind, like a piece of furniture someone didn´t have a use for anymore. People are cruel. He doesn´t understand that. He was in a bad condition when we gave him shelter, saved him by feeding him twice daily, pet & foster him everyday! "Tony" is a decent & modest cat and he now depends on us. I´m highly allergic, that´s why he can´t stay inside our home, but in the studio there would be "his" place, may I remind you of the strongs winters here. We wont let him down. 

Besides that we shelter two guinny pigs (since 2011) we saved them from the animal shelter and they don´t fit together in one household with "Tony" that well :)

"Elvis" & "Pauline" in their "vacation" box waiting for us to get their habitat cleaned. This is the only chance to take a sharp photo :)



The Impact of what you give and will get back 

We are asking you to help us raise the princely sum of 11.497,50$. Over 67.000€ we invested and we have to make a living wage soon. 

The most important point is, this isn´t a charity fund-raiser. This is your chance to own one of these great works at a great saving. For every amazing supporter of our venture we created highly collectible works. We are grateful and deeply happy about being self employed. You help us being free again, so we have to give something of great value back. Every perk is calculated low, that your only chance to get them is here. (e.g. "Early Bird" limited Edition 199$ instead shop price 642$)

All Perks include worldwide shipping & are limited Editions dear friends!

We need the 11.497,50$ for:
  • paint for walls & ceilings (materials & incidentials) 800$
  • setting up drywalls 775$
  • install basic track & spot light system 2250$
  • 3 large acryl glass mounted prints (each 775$) 2325$
  • 2 desks, shelves, chairs, small counter (all second hand!) ± 475$
  • install smoke pipe for chimney or compensates the heating cost for 1.st winter ± 2500$
  • Fees 4% & transaction 3% & taxes 19% will add up to 2372,50$ - what a bummer :( 

The savings from my nana keep depleting and she´s 91 already. She deserves to see our finished atelier for her 92 B´day on 12/24/2014 and this can just work if you believe in my complete honesty. 

The expenses for pizzas & beers for our helping hands and maintaining the studio will be covered be us. :) 

Every Perk is highly valuable & strictly limited to indiegogo pledges 

Introducing "Perk Tuesday", well curated stunning perk weekly!
EARLY BIRD: #17 "One-of-a-kind" A-0 Size Pigment-Giclée: EXCLUSIVELY to first 35 contributors, Limited Edition of 1, first come-first serve, you choose the motif (see gallery), signed, numbered, coa, museum archival quality & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping + pair of white cotton gloves - 33,5"x47" - 199$ (shop price 642$!!)
#1 The power of "2": We started in pairs and if you donate a pair (2) $, we will love you, high-five you and compliment your good looks or moustache (it´s part of our Logo) + Guestlist for every Event (if we get that stretch goal) we host 2014-15 at our Atelier +handed out limited print 4,35"x6"  - 2$
#2 The power of "5": including all the above + my nana will keep you in her prayers, every night! - 5$
#3 Guitar Serenade played by Uwe: Every contribution helps, and for 10$ you will receive a special video message from us with Uwe playing a song for you on his Guitar. You´ll be glad, there´ll be no singing, that happens under the shower, of course without you - 10$
#4 signed Postcard: motive from our Portfolio, send personally via mail, mail & Jack the Flipper stamped, a collectible (for art auctions in the future), expressing our eternal gratitude for your support- 15$

#5 Sponsor Studio Cat "Tony" for 7d: Tony has been abondoned and we adopted him. However he can´t live in our home (I´m highly allergic & we house 2 Guinney Pigs), in the atelier we´ll provide shelter for him. We love him, feed him twice a day and pet & foster him daily - 25$
#6_1 One Waterdrop "Tutelum" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print  & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 5,1"x7" - 35$
#6 One Waterdrop "Aquanoxi Dancer" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 5,1"x7" - 35$
#7 One Waterdrop "Columna" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 5,1"x7" - 35$
#8 One Waterdrop "Umbella" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 5,1"x7" - 35$
#9 One Waterdrop "Achtfugit" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 5,1"x7" - 35$
#10 One Waterdrop "Diadema" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 5,1"x7" - 35$
#11 Large Waterdrop: "Aquanoxi Dancer" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$
#12 Large Waterdrop "Columna" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$
#13 Large Waterdrop "Tutelum" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$
#14 Large Waterdrop "Umbella" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum archival quality & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$
#15 Large Waterdrop "Diadema" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$
#16 Large Waterdrop "Achtfugit" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$
#18 Live with "Jack the Flipper": No, you cannot move in nor live with us, that would be frivolous. But we will join forces and chat with you 30min on skype, not naked but still will answer all you´d like to know (e.g. technical, personal, visionary, etc.pp.) of every topic you´re interested in - 375$
#19 "Right of Pre-Emption for upcoming Artworks": Your heavenly contribution expands our growth by years. Well contact you personally (e.g. skype) about the progress and details. Tripple your happiness & shower in good karma by choosing your 3 favorite motif´s from JtF. They´ll be signed, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & ready for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 3 x 39,4"x55" - 2500$
#20 "JtF builds your Waterdrop Studio" - 2 day VIP incl. EVERYTHING: Feel good about your pledge and just let us do the work, you sit back & relax. If you want to come, we will organize it all for you (internat. flights, 5* hotel, transfers, 3* food, etc.).  OR: We visit you personally. I helped organizing the MTV Europe Music Awards in Stockholm, I know exactly how to enchant you with every thoughtful detail. You´ll be treated like Madonna, Robbie Williams and Kylie. You are our Super Star. We´ll built your Waterdrop Studio anywhere in the world! - 15.000$ 
Stretch Goals
Every contribution will be absolutely grateful, however the Big Gamechanger would be installing a washingroom.
  • MANDATORY by law is installing a patrons washingroom, if we want to host anything (exhibitions, workshops, events, art dinners, etc.), this big gamechanger gulps about (±12500$)
  • flooring professionally done (±2800$)
  • expand space for hosting workshops (two linked garages) + 390sq.ft. (100$/month = 1200$/y)
  • 2.nd slide projector (±350$) or beamer (±875$) + screen (±500$)
  • "Aqua Momentum" by JtF - A visual journey unraveling the mysterys of the hidden beauty evolving while dropping water - Hard Cover Book - 32pages - Edition of 150 x 49$ - (7350$)
  • "ICELAND by JtF" - Hard COVER BOOK - 80pages - Edition of 100 x 99$ - (9900$)
  • host an unheard of Christmas 2014 Party for underpriveleged teenagers & kids including X-Mas Workshop, repeatable, ± 50$/Kid, 30 Kids - (1500$)
  • opening party for all of you backers incl. unique gifts, a tour, Q&A, food & drinks!! (±40$/backer)
  • Airbrush our Logo on the steal door (±220$)
  • Signs leading the way: 3ft x 3ft in frontyard & 6ft x 3ft frontwall (± 675$)
  • install Alarmsystem (±950$)
  • replace single glaze windows | reduce heating costs (± 3250$)
  • basement (300sq.ft.) is permeable, has to be excavated (??$) 
  • Art Café & Workshops in winter garden,  (± 50.000$)
  • rent Kiravan for photo adventures, like "Tierra del Fuego", "New Zealand", "Japan", etc.

Business Proof

In 2005 me & Uwe (my BF) where offered to take over a sinking video rental store, we where given 14 days to decide. I was Producer for public TV and Uwe (also corporate) branch manager of a store. We had so little time, no experience, help or assets, but deep down we knew, just working self-employed would fulfill ourselves. Everyone disadvised us! Yet 7 days later we stood in our store and signed a contract of paying 245.000$ takeover price + 370.000$ in rent over 6,5 years. We started from scratch and managed it all. With 72h/week we where burned out (read above) and had to sell in 2012. We had to agree to monthly rates, and this is breaking our necks now. Because the phoney we sold to isn´t paying us anymore, last payment was X-mas 2013. He´s is trying to ruin us. But we don´t give up. We have a lawyer, no one can break us. 

Last day @ our store: Sascha, Matthew & Uwe | 5/31/2012 (When we didn´t see all that coming...)


Why is failure not an option?

For sure there´ll be set backs and lows, but what can I say, we always proceed and at last prevail. There are no obsticles or hurdles we wont climp. We are 3 dedicated artists & entrepreneurs, every one is playing in his own field of expertise. Together we are strong and believe in us, we prooved it in our lifes. 

We´ve come to far to fail with "Jack the Flipper"!

Everything can be lighter than it seems - we´re in our mid - late 30´s - we have the experience. Both in business and life. Corporate jobs and self-employed ventures made us solid. Illnesses in our close family (mostly cancer) welded us together. 

I (Sascha) organized up to 6 hours of Live TV Broadcasting (+120 Crew) and dealt with constant changes of the fixed shedule while on air coordinating all the different divisions to keep the show running and getting back on track. Nothing will work as planned, but I always have a plan upfront. So I know how to work under stress with immediate reacting on the circumstances. Always focussed.

We know our strenghts and flaws. We started with nothing, we faced banruptcy with our store 2 times, but always kept going, without banks and their stinky money! 

No one and no thing can bring us down. 

We are proud & free of balasts. Join us & together we can rise. 

Together Uwe & me moved 3 times, everytime we got rid of 50-70% of the stuff we possed. Right now we´re living on 500sq.ft. and have all in all 15 drawers. How many do you have? 

We freed ourselves from posessions, because they posessed us. Our dream is that we can carry everything we need to own as carry-on luggage, of course the photography equipment goes extra ;)

Our Biographys

Share our journey if you feel confident - you count!

More valuable than money is getting us THE contact!!

Maybe you can connect us with an influencer (Art collector, reporter, blogger, etc.) - than we will grant you a wish!!

Please use the Indiegogo sharing tool, that would be awesome it helps spread the word of our art enterprise, every click counts for us. May you be blessed with our eternal gratitude. 

Thank you for listening, affectionate regards Sascha Hojzakowa | Jack the Flipper


    Anke, Markus, Uwe & Sascha - Jack the Flipper | Artwork & Photography
