We started talking about both our passion photography, one thing let to another, so we spent the whole winter 2011-12 in the basement and started to shoot waterdrops. In the end we had built a professional waterdrop studio and took +10.000 pictures. Every single sculpture was different - I can tell you!
Impossible to reproduce - shot in a 10.000th of a second. 
The obvious may hide an awesome spectacle - who knew - until JtF comes a long and unravels it. Flash yourself with our "discovery" - the visual impact is sensational: 

  
"Tutelum"                                  "Aquanoxi Dancer"               "Columna"
"Aqua Momentum" we called this scientific series. 6 motifs are in this Edition. 


  "Umbella"                                  "Diadema"                                "Achtfugit"
We where more than impressed by the results we got from hundreds of hours of experimenting and shooting these sculptures. It was a huge scientific project combined with our artistic vision of unraveling the mystery - uncapable for the human eye to observe - of such a common thing (to us industrialized nations) like water. In this case Waterdrops. 
Often the precious things lie directly in front of you, but if you look closely you can make it visible.
These are 100% photographys, no digital manipulation at all. 

Below "Making of Aqua Momentum" - The device imported from US: StopShot





 


I feel to get personal for 2 mins to honor my nana


My BF and I spent 6,5y of our lives every day (6d/12h) to keep our store running & to make the customers happy.....we somehow lost ourselves on the way. In 2012 we had to sell our store due to worse getting burnout sympthoms. I got cardiac arrhythmia, insomnia & lost 50p. Uwe (my BF) got a ping-pong-ball size tumor, right under his ear in the salivary gland. 
When he had to stay in the hospital (3 weeks), I couldn´t visit him just once because I had to run our business (aftermath: half his face including one ear is completely numb). Since december 2013 we are struggling financially. The buyer of our store isn´t paying the monthly rates anymore and already resold "our" business.
Without my nana - born christmas eve 1922 - we (Uwe & Me) would be lost, she´s financing our lives with her pension. She prays for us everyday and deeply believes in our enterprise. All this wouldn´t be possible without her. She hardly survived the dark nazi times,  I love you Nana!



  Thats her & me (Sascha) 
You play the most important role to help us prospering. Its a timely matter.
The Logo - 100% soul 
The conception & creation of our logo took us 3 weeks and you´ll see, it was totally worth it, it combines everything we are. Before rendering it had 177 photoshop layers and was 2,7gb large. We put 100% of our soul & love into everything we create!




+67.000€ we invested until today in living expenses, equipment, photo projects, health insurance and printing our works and keep it all running. Yes €, not $. (most part on Markus, he owns all the equipment) 
Each accomplishment, we created/reached by ourselves, e.g. Logos, layout, design, post production, publishing, public relations, etc. 
However our clock is ticking, we maxed out our budget and by the end of the year we have to earn money. Or we will loose everything. Even our home. Seriously.
There is our plain & structured website, blog & social media with published new works nourished daily with stunning accompanying texts by Uwe (top expert).
The composition & development (of our works) account for our backgound as classical studied painters, regard the classical definition of fine-arts.  

                 
Paris 2 | France                                                        Le Mont Saint Michel 5 | France
Eastbourne Grand Pier 2 | England


Dyrhólaey Seaside 1 | Iceland (blue hour at it´s finest - see more...)


Godafoss Herd of Horses 1 | Iceland (by fluke this herd passed by - see more...)Yoda says: "Social Proof you have"
All online stuff we have fulfilled so far, Uwe nurses daily (flickr, g+, FB, instagram, 500px, fotocommunity, blog, homepage, shop and answering every question)
The social media feedback we receive is overwhelming.

+2.000.000 hits on our G+ must mean we have social proof!

 
De Val 1 | Netherlands (G+)  +478               Flower 37 | Flower (tumblr) +1041

Our "425.000$" Online Shop - I´m not kidding
And that isn´t fairly enough... Do the math friends. The daily rate of a newcomer photographer is (890€) 1180$, we are far beyond that, as you observed.  We worked 6 months to realize our design concept, capture all the pictures and fulfill all the business administration. That´ll add up to 424.800$. Wooooow.
Another calculation example: Below is a productphoto we shot for our online shop. 24 motifs we finalized - each captured with 220-300 different settings - that´s ± 5300 pictures we created, multiply them by let´s say 40$ each (incl. Studio, post processing) = 212.000$. Again. Wooooooooow.
You see, it isn´t really easy to put that in numbers.  It was our artistic vision. We wanted to create a shop where we spend our money. You can see, that we thought every part of it through. 
It´s the realization of our vision, we dedicated all our heart & soul into this project. What do you think? 




"Jökulsárlón Seaside 2 | 2013 - Living Room Example from JtF-Shop" -  http://jacktheflipper-shop.com
During this product shot the ice kept melting and melting, turning everything into a constant mess.  We mopped up the water to get the set pristine again and again, and....we wanted to reflect the feeling of ICELAND :-)

So far we have created nearly 8 TB of data for "Jack the Flipper", this split up into +33.000 files organized in +22.000 folders. I told you, every itsy-bitsy mosaic piece WE created. 
You see, we are pushing ourselves or are we going insane? Hahaha... :)

Jack the Flipper - Offline World
"Jack the Flipper" is an officially licensed business in the offline world, too.
In an upscale hairsalon we´re already on display with 10 of our works +10 ready to frame archival prints in a display (see below), this investment alone was 1175$ for us.


 
Above: Printing (Canon IPF 9400 - 12 inks!) & Preparing the COA for each work
Below: Stamping & sealing off our framed works & the 10 finished ones

 


 Above: Our works @ Fine Hairdressing Salon "Abschnitt"

We don´t trust the system - so let´s hack it :) 
We worked with galerists etc., but we don´t trust the "old" system, we want to hack it - thanks Timothy Ferriss :)  Rely on yourself. So do we.


 Markus & Sascha

We are proud. We follow our vision. We work hard. Do you see we are driven?!

Art Cologne | Fine arts market proof - we got!
Before JtF - when Markus created unique fine-art works - he sold +12 paintings (5.000€ & up). One was sold even before "ArtCologne 2006" opened for 6.500€. "The World our Dream | 2007" took a month to create and has never been offered for sale - it reflects the profound understanding of Markus in technique and creativity. It´s 3D painted in oil-on-chalk-on-canvas-on-wood, he has been taught this craft by his Prof. Nikolaj Fedkovic who sold these apiece for high five-figures. Since this was 8 years ago - everyone forgot. 
Starting in late September 2014 we´ll create large scale artworks in our Atelier.
This gets us back on the art market and our Perks become valuable collectibles. Promised!

Below: Markus Brungs creating "The World our Dream | 2007" inspired from the correspondant poem by Hermann Hesse





 Above: Markus working on the intricate details of this masterpiece                      Below: Most early step - creating the 3D chalk letters to "write" the poem onto 

 




Above: Coloring the 3D letters - can you read the poem - it´s in german :)



Above: final work "The World our Dream |  2007" - the whole work is in 3D - but the effect is hardly visible on these photos. 
"Venice | Markus Brungs | 2002" Edition of 15 motifs painted in India ink and acrylic paint - digital scans of original fine-art works - selection of 5 below 









There is so much more to tell about us....but I have to cut to the chase. 

Project - Atelier - Background
We require an Atelier | Studio. We need to shake the market with our works. We have to act. You play the crucial part here dear backers. Please act now. 
The place has an industrial character and huge potential to start our offline enterprise, it´s about 700sq.ft, however it needs urgent remodelling. We got the keys and already started with heavy cleaning, preparations and painting. 
What can you do there?



creative workspace for Markus, Uwe & Sascha

create new Artworks again (century old skillful techniques which we master)
starting late September with a new Edition of large scale Artworks
execute new scientific photo projects 
host accompanying workshops

picture framing services

free workshops & events for the not so fortunate (req. washing room/see stretch goals) 
host Art Dinners with local bands/DJ´s (req. washing room)
hold competitions

offer Internships for students (req. washing room)

encounter with you & show our works
see workflow, insights and backgrounds of our world

share our knowledge & we boost your skills


explain our equipment
the place where you can pet our atelier cat "Tony" :)

You can put us on the map and make us real. You only have the force!

Your support is vital to the success of this campaign, we take every risk to realize our venture, we know our strengths, we´ve worked so much and won´t back down. Never. 
We follow our dream & passion and you be the crucial part, our funding-fathers. 
Big Inspirer
Peter Lik is a legend! He´s an big inspirer and a self made man. That´s what we adore about him. He´s living proof. We have a lot in common - apart from him already beeing on the summit. Just follow your path. You can only be free, if you free yourself from contraints put on you by others. 
Every progress we´ll document every on our social-media profiles. 
Further assurance for YOU: Our business ia laywered up by Thoms & Hugl
"Tony" the abandoned cat  
He was left behind, like a piece of furniture someone didn´t have a use for anymore. People are cruel. He doesn´t understand that. He was in a bad condition when we gave him shelter, saved him by feeding him twice daily, pet & foster him everyday! "Tony" is a decent & modest cat and he now depends on us. I´m highly allergic, that´s why he can´t stay inside our home, but in the studio there would be "his" place, may I remind you of the strongs winters here. We wont let him down. 
Besides that we shelter two guinny pigs (since 2011) we saved them from the animal shelter and they don´t fit together in one household with "Tony" that well :)



"Elvis" & "Pauline" in their "vacation" box waiting for us to get their habitat cleaned. This is the only chance to take a sharp photo :)
  


The Impact of what you give and will get back 

We are asking you to help us raise the princely sum of 11.497,50$. Over 67.000€ we invested and we have to make a living wage soon. 
The most important point is, this isn´t a charity fund-raiser. This is your chance to own one of these great works at a great saving. For every amazing supporter of our venture we created highly collectible works. We are grateful and deeply happy about being self employed. You help us being free again, so we have to give something of great value back. Every perk is calculated low, that your only chance to get them is here. (e.g. "Early Bird" limited Edition 199$ instead shop price 642$)
All Perks include worldwide shipping & are limited Editions dear friends!We need the 11.497,50$ for:
paint for walls & ceilings (materials & incidentials) 800$

setting up drywalls 775$
install basic track & spot light system 2250$
3 large acryl glass mounted prints (each 775$) 2325$
2 desks, shelves, chairs, small counter (all second hand!) ± 475$
install smoke pipe for chimney or compensates the heating cost for 1.st winter ± 2500$
Fees 4% & transaction 3% & taxes 19% will add up to 2372,50$ - what a bummer :( 

 The savings from my nana keep depleting and she´s 91 already. She deserves to see our finished atelier for her 92 B´day on 12/24/2014 and this can just work if you believe in my complete honesty. 
The expenses for pizzas & beers for our helping hands and maintaining the studio will be covered be us. :) 
Every Perk is highly valuable & strictly limited to indiegogo pledges 
Introducing "Perk Tuesday", well curated stunning perk weekly!

EARLY BIRD: #17 "One-of-a-kind" A-0 Size Pigment-Giclée: EXCLUSIVELY to first 35 contributors, Limited Edition of 1, first come-first serve, you choose the motif (see gallery), signed, numbered, coa, museum archival quality & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping + pair of white cotton gloves - 33,5"x47" - 199$ (shop price 642$!!)


#1 The power of "2": We started in pairs and if you donate a pair (2) $, we will love you, high-five you and compliment your good looks or moustache (it´s part of our Logo) + Guestlist for every Event (if we get that stretch goal) we host 2014-15 at our Atelier +handed out limited print 4,35"x6"  - 2$


#2 The power of "5": including all the above + my nana will keep you in her prayers, every night! - 5$


#3 Guitar Serenade played by Uwe: Every contribution helps, and for 10$ you will receive a special video message from us with Uwe playing a song for you on his Guitar. You´ll be glad, there´ll be no singing, that happens under the shower, of course without you - 10$


#4 signed Postcard: motive from our Portfolio, send personally via mail, mail & Jack the Flipper stamped, a collectible (for art auctions in the future), expressing our eternal gratitude for your support- 15$


#5 Sponsor Studio Cat "Tony" for 7d: Tony has been abondoned and we adopted him. However he can´t live in our home (I´m highly allergic & we house 2 Guinney Pigs), in the atelier we´ll provide shelter for him. We love him, feed him twice a day and pet & foster him daily - 25$


#6_1 One Waterdrop "Tutelum" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print  & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 5,1"x7" - 35$


#6 One Waterdrop "Aquanoxi Dancer" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 5,1"x7" - 35$


#7 One Waterdrop "Columna" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 5,1"x7" - 35$


#8 One Waterdrop "Umbella" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 5,1"x7" - 35$


#9 One Waterdrop "Achtfugit" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 5,1"x7" - 35$


#10 One Waterdrop "Diadema" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 75, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 5,1"x7" - 35$


#11 Large Waterdrop: "Aquanoxi Dancer" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$


#12 Large Waterdrop "Columna" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$


#13 Large Waterdrop "Tutelum" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$


#14 Large Waterdrop "Umbella" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum archival quality & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$


#15 Large Waterdrop "Diadema" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$


#16 Large Waterdrop "Achtfugit" - Limited Indiegogo edition of 45, signed, numbered, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & suitable for framing, incl. worldwide shipping  - 8,5"x11" - 99$


#18 Live with "Jack the Flipper": No, you cannot move in nor live with us, that would be frivolous. But we will join forces and chat with you 30min on skype, not naked but still will answer all you´d like to know (e.g. technical, personal, visionary, etc.pp.) of every topic you´re interested in - 375$


#19 "Right of Pre-Emption for upcoming Artworks": Your heavenly contribution expands our growth by years. Well contact you personally (e.g. skype) about the progress and details. Tripple your happiness & shower in good karma by choosing your 3 favorite motif´s from JtF. They´ll be signed, coa with stamp, museum grade gilcée print & ready for framing, incl. worldwide shipping - 3 x 39,4"x55" - 2500$


#20 "JtF builds your Waterdrop Studio" - 2 day VIP incl. EVERYTHING: Feel good about your pledge and just let us do the work, you sit back & relax. If you want to come, we will organize it all for you (internat. flights, 5* hotel, transfers, 3* food, etc.).  OR: We visit you personally. I helped organizing the MTV Europe Music Awards in Stockholm, I know exactly how to enchant you with every thoughtful detail. You´ll be treated like Madonna, Robbie Williams and Kylie. You are our Super Star. We´ll built your Waterdrop Studio anywhere in the world! - 15.000$ 

Stretch Goals

Every contribution will be absolutely grateful, however the Big Gamechanger would be installing a washingroom.


MANDATORY by law is installing a patrons washingroom, if we want to host anything (exhibitions, workshops, events, art dinners, etc.), this big gamechanger gulps about (±12500$)

flooring professionally done (±2800$)

expand space for hosting workshops (two linked garages) + 390sq.ft. (100$/month = 1200$/y)
2.nd slide projector (±350$) or beamer (±875$) + screen (±500$)

"Aqua Momentum" by JtF - A visual journey unraveling the mysterys of the hidden beauty evolving while dropping water - Hard Cover Book - 32pages - Edition of 150 x 49$ - (7350$)

"ICELAND by JtF" - Hard COVER BOOK - 80pages - Edition of 100 x 99$ - (9900$)
host an unheard of Christmas 2014 Party for underpriveleged teenagers & kids including X-Mas Workshop, repeatable, ± 50$/Kid, 30 Kids - (1500$)

opening party for all of you backers incl. unique gifts, a tour, Q&A, food & drinks!! (±40$/backer)

Airbrush our Logo on the steal door (±220$)

Signs leading the way: 3ft x 3ft in frontyard & 6ft x 3ft frontwall (± 675$)
install Alarmsystem (±950$)

replace single glaze windows | reduce heating costs (± 3250$)
basement (300sq.ft.) is permeable, has to be excavated (??$) 

Art Café & Workshops in winter garden,  (± 50.000$)
rent Kiravan for photo adventures, like "Tierra del Fuego", "New Zealand", "Japan", etc.

  Business Proof
In 2005 me & Uwe (my BF) where offered to take over a sinking video rental store, we where given 14 days to decide. I was Producer for public TV and Uwe (also corporate) branch manager of a store. We had so little time, no experience, help or assets, but deep down we knew, just working self-employed would fulfill ourselves. Everyone disadvised us! Yet 7 days later we stood in our store and signed a contract of paying 245.000$ takeover price + 370.000$ in rent over 6,5 years. We started from scratch and managed it all. With 72h/week we where burned out (read above) and had to sell in 2012. We had to agree to monthly rates, and this is breaking our necks now. Because the phoney we sold to isn´t paying us anymore, last payment was X-mas 2013. He´s is trying to ruin us. But we don´t give up. We have a lawyer, no one can break us. 



Last day @ our store: Sascha, Matthew & Uwe | 5/31/2012 (When we didn´t see all that coming...)
Why is failure not an option?
For sure there´ll be set backs and lows, but what can I say, we always proceed and at last prevail. There are no obsticles or hurdles we wont climp. We are 3 dedicated artists & entrepreneurs, every one is playing in his own field of expertise. Together we are strong and believe in us, we prooved it in our lifes. 
We´ve come to far to fail with "Jack the Flipper"!
Everything can be lighter than it seems - we´re in our mid - late 30´s - we have the experience. Both in business and life. Corporate jobs and self-employed ventures made us solid. Illnesses in our close family (mostly cancer) welded us together. 
I (Sascha) organized up to 6 hours of Live TV Broadcasting (+120 Crew) and dealt with constant changes of the fixed shedule while on air coordinating all the different divisions to keep the show running and getting back on track. Nothing will work as planned, but I always have a plan upfront. So I know how to work under stress with immediate reacting on the circumstances. Always focussed.
We know our strenghts and flaws. We started with nothing, we faced banruptcy with our store 2 times, but always kept going, without banks and their stinky money! 
No one and no thing can bring us down. 
We are proud & free of balasts. Join us & together we can rise. 
Together Uwe & me moved 3 times, everytime we got rid of 50-70% of the stuff we possed. Right now we´re living on 500sq.ft. and have all in all 15 drawers. How many do you have? 
We freed ourselves from posessions, because they posessed us. Our dream is that we can carry everything we need to own as carry-on luggage, of course the photography equipment goes extra ;)
Our Biographys

Share our journey if you feel confident - you count! More valuable than money is getting us THE contact!!
Maybe you can connect us with an influencer (Art collector, reporter, blogger, etc.) - than we will grant you a wish!!
Please use the Indiegogo sharing tool, that would be awesome it helps spread the word of our art enterprise, every click counts for us. May you be blessed with our eternal gratitude. 
Thank you for listening, affectionate regards Sascha Hojzakowa | Jack the Flipper

 
Anke, Markus, Uwe & Sascha - Jack the Flipper | Artwork & Photography

story:
Bref résumé

Ce projet veut mettre en avant les artistes dans la domaine de la coiffure et ce dans un souci pan-africaniste mais également dans un esprit de créativité afro-européenne.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Les récoltes de fonds ainsi que les demandes de subsides ne sont pas choses aisées. Il est donc intéressant de faire appel à une certaine solidarité pour un événement phare qui au fond, concerne tout un chacun. Avec seulement 10.000 euros on peut faire quelque chose de grandiose quand certains vont jusqu'à dépenser un minimum de 50,000 euros et jusqu'à 100.000 euros pour un événement similaire!

    L'impact

    Ce projet a été réfléchi depuis de nombreuses années mais ce n'est seulement qu'en 2012 qu'il a germé. Après avoir observé ce qui se fait ailleurs, Bruxelles semblait être le lieu adéquat pour bouleverser les mentalités. Il s'agit, en effet, par le biais d'un tel événement de mettre un peu plus en lumière un monde, au fond, peu connu du public autochtone. On parle souvent de pénurie en matière d'emploi. Ces jeunes talents sont des acteurs potentiels de développement. Ils ont tous en leur cœur d'ouvrir leur propre salon de coiffure ou de beauté pour certains. Ils seront obligés d'engager du personnel! Quelle belle opportunité pour le ciel belge car tous ne sont pas originaires de Bruxelles mais viennent d'un peu partout en Belgique!

    • Le défi est tentant de voir ce que pourra donner cet événement par la suite
    • Les événements organisés par Mkz Events ont permis la création d'un réseau de relations porteur. En effet, quelques-uns ont évolué dans le domaine de la mode, la télévision ou la chanson.

    Risques et défis

    La Belgique n'est pas suffisamment bien représentée quant à la diversité des personnes qui évoluent dans le domaine artistique. C'est la raison pour laquelle l'idée de faire connaître les talents de la coiffure prend tout son sens dans la réalisation de ce projet: le monde de la coiffure afro à Bruxelles semble être un monde fermé surtout lorsqu'on entend "coiffure" on pense "Matonge"! Un lieu insolite haut et plein en couleur! Certes! Mais il n'y a pas que Matonge! Tous les talents sont dispersés et on les a trouvé. Vous aurez l'occasion de voir par vous-même un "échantillon" très représentatif de ce qui existe concrètement. Vous découvrirez un univers dont vous n'aurez pas idée!
    • Le projet peut devenir un flop si personne ne manifeste son intérêt
    • Quelle curiosité mais surtout quel défi de voir des coiffures "afro" comme on n'en voit pas d'habitude sur des mannequins africains mais également sur des mannequins européens! 

    D'autres façons d'aider

    Vous n'êtes évidemment pas obligé de contribuer financièrement, il y a des actions toutes aussi importantes:

    • Parlez de cet événement autour de vous; surtout si vous avez des amis travaillant à la radio, à la télé ou dans les magazines
    • Si vous disposez de coussins dont vous ne vous en servez plus et s'ils sont propres surtout ne les jetez pas; nous les utiliserons pour les mettre dans un espace destiné à nos tous petits pendant la journée car des animations sont prévues pour eux pendant la journée!

Bref résumé
Ce projet veut mettre en avant les artistes dans la domaine de la coiffure et ce dans un souci pan-africaniste mais également dans un esprit de créativité afro-européenne.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez
Les récoltes de fonds ainsi que les demandes de subsides ne sont pas choses aisées. Il est donc intéressant de faire appel à une certaine solidarité pour un événement phare qui au fond, concerne tout un chacun. Avec seulement 10.000 euros on peut faire quelque chose de grandiose quand certains vont jusqu'à dépenser un minimum de 50,000 euros et jusqu'à 100.000 euros pour un événement similaire!


L'impact
Ce projet a été réfléchi depuis de nombreuses années mais ce n'est seulement qu'en 2012 qu'il a germé. Après avoir observé ce qui se fait ailleurs, Bruxelles semblait être le lieu adéquat pour bouleverser les mentalités. Il s'agit, en effet, par le biais d'un tel événement de mettre un peu plus en lumière un monde, au fond, peu connu du public autochtone. On parle souvent de pénurie en matière d'emploi. Ces jeunes talents sont des acteurs potentiels de développement. Ils ont tous en leur cœur d'ouvrir leur propre salon de coiffure ou de beauté pour certains. Ils seront obligés d'engager du personnel! Quelle belle opportunité pour le ciel belge car tous ne sont pas originaires de Bruxelles mais viennent d'un peu partout en Belgique!


Le défi est tentant de voir ce que pourra donner cet événement par la suite
Les événements organisés par Mkz Events ont permis la création d'un réseau de relations porteur. En effet, quelques-uns ont évolué dans le domaine de la mode, la télévision ou la chanson.


Risques et défis
 
La Belgique n'est pas suffisamment bien représentée quant à la diversité des personnes qui évoluent dans le domaine artistique. C'est la raison pour laquelle l'idée de faire connaître les talents de la coiffure prend tout son sens dans la réalisation de ce projet: le monde de la coiffure afro à Bruxelles semble être un monde fermé surtout lorsqu'on entend "coiffure" on pense "Matonge"! Un lieu insolite haut et plein en couleur! Certes! Mais il n'y a pas que Matonge! Tous les talents sont dispersés et on les a trouvé. Vous aurez l'occasion de voir par vous-même un "échantillon" très représentatif de ce qui existe concrètement. Vous découvrirez un univers dont vous n'aurez pas idée!

Le projet peut devenir un flop si personne ne manifeste son intérêt
Quelle curiosité mais surtout quel défi de voir des coiffures "afro" comme on n'en voit pas d'habitude sur des mannequins africains mais également sur des mannequins européens! 


D'autres façons d'aider
Vous n'êtes évidemment pas obligé de contribuer financièrement, il y a des actions toutes aussi importantes:

Parlez de cet événement autour de vous; surtout si vous avez des amis travaillant à la radio, à la télé ou dans les magazines
Si vous disposez de coussins dont vous ne vous en servez plus et s'ils sont propres surtout ne les jetez pas; nous les utiliserons pour les mettre dans un espace destiné à nos tous petits pendant la journée car des animations sont prévues pour eux pendant la journée!

story:
What We Do...

Visible Bodies is a transgender community art initiative.  Every participant in our project has had their photo taken in a way that represents their gender or transition -- whatever that means to them.  In addition, each participant has written a short personal piece as a caption to their photograph.

Our goal is to provide a platform for trans people of all different walks of life to tell their stories. We seek to empower our own community, and educate people outside of our community.  

Thus far, all photography has been done by Wolfgang, an ally to the transgender community who produces work of the highest quality.

 

Where We Started...

Visible Bodies began as a student project at University of California, San Diego.  Our goal was to create a body of work that would make the campus LGBT Resource Center more welcoming to transgender students.  

In mid-2012, we opened the project to the larger San Diego community.  At our opening show in May 2013, we highlighted the stories of 31 transgender San Diegans. 

The response to Visible Bodies has been overwhelmingly positive.  Read more in the recent Advocate article, San Diego CityBeat, San Diego LGBT Weekly, or City Times San Diego.  

 

Where We're Going...

The next step for Visible Bodies is to branch out to different cities.  Organizers in Portland and Minneapolis are eager to begin production on their own Visible Bodies projects.  

We also look forward to displaying the original Visible Bodies work in galleries in southern California and beyond.  We're working hard on a digitized version of the project, which will allow us to take the work farther and wider.

 

What You Can Do...  

As a grassroots project, our funding comes entirely in the form of donations like yours.  Any amount of money you can give will help fuel this incredible phenomenon.

For more information, go to our website, http://visiblebodies.org.  If you'd like to get involved as a volunteer, participant, or organizer, contact us at VisibleBodies@gmail.com.  You can also find us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/VisibleBodies.

story:
Our Mission

To empower the local community through education, music, art, permaculture and sustainability.

Description

A little red brick house was donated in June of 2012, to a dedicated bunch of activists who had a vision. Through the efforts of many volunteers that Li'l red house has become "Pueblo House" where meetings will be held for the local community and other organizations who wish to bring their voices together for the betterment of the Community and the Nation.
Recently we were donated a second house in May of 2013 (also over 100 years old) where we hope to be able to move forward on building a Music & Art center. We have musicians and artists who have offered to be part of Pueblo House, who offer their talent (in both music and art) so kids can find their own voice through creativity. We believe kids need an avenue to express themselves. Alais Clay is one such artist, who speaks both Spanish and English, which is important given the area is mainly Latino. Many boarded up houses lined the streets, but new energy is slowly being pumped in. However, we need funds to help us with equipment, art supplies and musical instruments, which are not accessible to us until we have our 501c3 status, applied for in August of 2012 and still pending.
Both houses will be open to the public. Pueblo House was largely finished due to donations. The reason we have been successful in getting this far is because we have the support of local people both long time residents of Pueblo, who believe in what we’re doing and who have watched us work diligently over the past 19 months. Many others have poured hours upon hours of work into Pueblo House. We hope that you will help us build our dream school for music and art or possibly donate your time or skills. It takes a village and we have a very cooperative village.

 Pueblo House, where ideas are shared and visions are brought to life.

What We Need & What You Get

Needs:

  • $1600 for electrical box to the house
  • $2400 to repair the water main break at the roadway
  • $1000 for roof & eve repairs
  • donations of electrical wire or another $800 raised for wiring inside the house
  • donations of plumbing materials or $1200 raised for plumbing supplies
  • donations of plaster, cement and floor sander rentals or $500 in funding
  • $3000 to acquire a 3rd house, same street, which would be a media center

In return here's what we'll provide

  • We're planning a very creative walkway made by the kids and using bricks inscribed with the names of donators who provide $25 or more.  Each brick will be hand painted by someone (an artist) at the house.
  • For contributions over $500 we'll have an artist do a personalized sculpture.

Your contribution:

  • Will help build a village with those things we feel are important to kids of all ages.
  • Renovate a 2nd and/or purchase a 3rd house for taxes outstanding.
  • Bring out the voice of children on the east side.
  • Provide self-esteem for young people who might be struggling in school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • We're asking for your help to get the word out.
  • Perhaps you can donate your time or a trade?
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to pass around to your friends!

story:
Our Goal

We are Owen and Sara David, two siblings and multidisciplinary artists initiating a collaborative work on Filipino history and diasporic identity. 

While the both of us were born in the Philippines, we ultimately grew up American - going to suburban public schools, receiving college degrees, and then coming into our own as artists, educators, and arts advocates now based in Columbus OH, and Providence RI. 

We are reaching out to you to help support a summer of research in the Philippines, where we will be visiting sites, collecting stories, and laying the groundwork for what will be a novel based loosely on our family history. 

Why is this important?

Like many Filipino families, ours carries living memories stretching back to the handover at the end of the Spanish-American war, through the Japanese Occupation during WWII, the dictatorship of Ferdinand Marcos and the People Power Revolution, the Asian Financial Crisis, and more contemporaneous pressures that have scattered Filipinos across the globe in search of better ways of living. 

For men and women of our generation, the ongoing impact of these events is gradually being forgotten as elders take their stories to the grave and migrant Filipinos adopt the narratives of their new home nations. 

We would like to use our own family history as a case study and point of entry for questions that we have about a postcolonial inheritance of longing, belonging, and loving. We want the chance to ask: what are the threads that bind us together, across space and time?

We need your help to begin a period of generative investigation, starting this summer. The histories we will discover and record have huge impact and importance--primary sources of Filipino life during and after Japanese occupation are few and far between. 

Besides academic potential, this trip holds personal and sentimental importance for both of us. We have not seen our family in the Philippines, including our 13 year old brother, for at least three years now. Because our family history is Filipino history, we want to learn it all and find a beautiful and meaningful way to preserve our stories.

(from our last visit to the Philippines, 2011)

About Us

Owen is a choreographer and scholar based in Columbus, OH, where he is teaching dance and dance composition at the Ohio State University. His work has been commissioned by the Harvard Ballet Company and presented by Movement Research in NYC, and he is now rehearsing for an upcoming presentation of his MFA thesis here(ing) at Links Hall in Chicago. Writing is integral to Owen’s creative process, and he regularly presents papers at the Congress on Research in Dance.

Sara is a writer and dancer based in Providence, RI. This year, she produced  the Rhythm of Change dance festival at Brown University, bringing over 20 artists from around the world to participate in a weekend of West African dance, art, and social activism. She is currently writing a book of short stories set to publish this spring. Her writing can be found on thought catalog, medium, and sublime. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are committed to returning to the Philippines to begin our work, but the scale and quality our research is dependent upon the amount of support that we receive. 

  • Our minimum goal is $2,500, which will fund airfare and green-light the creative process.
  • An additional $1,000 will compensate Owen and Sara for this month of work, essentially covering ongoing living expenses such food, medical and travel insurance, etc.
  • An additional $1,000 will fund travel to historical and ancestral sites across the Philippines, an archipelago of over seven thousand islands, with our own family’s lineage alone spanning the the breadth of its largest land mass, the island of Luzon.
  • An additional $2,000 will enable the procurement of recording equipment: Owen and Sara would like to travel with a microphone and an HD video camera in order to capture the best possible documentation of this field work.

To thank you for your generosity and support of this project, we are offering many perks and gifts, including:

  • Postcards and photos from the Philippines
  • A Skype call/thank you from us with our family in the Philippines
  • Audio or video sneak-peeks from our interviews
  • Acknowledgments in our work influenced by this trip, including our novel, dance pieces, or shorter written works
  • Comp tickets to any of Owen and/or Sara's dance performances/productions over the next 2 years

(a clip from Owen's 2013/2014 MFA piece)


(Sara's piece for Brown University's 2012 Fall Dance Concert)

Other Ways You Can Help

As students, we understand that sometimes you can't contribute financially, but that's not the only way you can help us! 

We would greatly appreciate it if you could share our campaign with anyone interested in the Philippines, diaspora, family, and art. Please share this campaign widely and help us in any way you can!

story:
Visual Artist Unit CIC Start-Up


Hello! 

We are Visual Artist Unit, an artist led not for profit Community Interest Company supporting emerging artists based in Scotland, and making contemporary art more accessible to the wider community.

Currently we are seeking properties in which to set up studio spaces in Glasgow and are planning a programme of pop-up exhibitions and public engagement activities across Scotland.


What we aim to do!

We will aim to provide groups of artists with generously sized studio spaces at affordable prices, with support to develop their practice through self-direction, group crits and skill share.

Simultaneously we will be inviting emerging artists from across the country to become members of VAU for opportunities to gain professional development experience through exhibiting their work and engaging with the wider community. Through our public engagement programme member artists will be invited to deliver talks and facilitate classes, workshops and skill share sessions in order to help make contemporary art more accessible for all. We also want to be able to pay artists for their services in support of  a-n's Paying Artists Campaign.


How can you help?


We need initial funds in order to:

  • Buy tools, equipment and materials for building and installing partitions to divide our premises into separate studio spaces
  • Buy tables, chairs, storage lockers and other equipment for artists studios
  • Pay for planning costs and venue hire fees to host a range of pop-up exhibitions and public engagement activities such as talks and workshops across Scotland.

Already we have an exhibition and artists discussion event organised for the Old Hairdresser's, Glasgow, 24th/25th August, and are currently seeking venues to host our first public art workshops.


Why should you help?

While we have been applying for funding through the likes of First Port and Creative Scotland, there are waits of up to 12 weeks to hear back with no guarantee of being successful. We want to have studio spaces and a planned programme of exhibitions, workshops and talks up and running as soon as possible, particularly in time to support the new wave of graduating artists this summer.

As recent graduate artists ourselves, we understand the urgent need for exhibition and professional development opportunities immediately upon graduating, as well as the impact a sudden loss of studio space, production facilities and peer support can have on the development of artists' work, particularly at a time when these things are most needed!


And in return...

       

       


We would never ask for your support without wanting to offer something in return so...... here are our perks:


£1 Thank You

A lovely personal thank you message from the VAU team


£5 Acknowledgement

Your name or company name acknowledged on the VAU website, and also invites to exhibition preview nights


£10 Handmade Sketchbook

A handmade sketchbook made by the VAU team


£25 Lucky Dip Artwork

A 'lucky dip' original A6 size artwork by a member of the VAU team


£35 Choose Your Own Artwork

An original A6 size artwork by a member of the VAU team of your choosing


£50 Everything!!!

An original A6 artwork of your choosing, a handmade sketchbook, acknowledgement on the VAU website and invites to exhibition preview nights



Skint but want to help?

Of course we recognise that not everyone is able to contribute financially even if they wanted to, and so if you are interested in our project and want to support us, we would greatly appreciate it if you spread the word to your friends, family, and anyone who you think may be interested!



THANK YOU!

Thanks for taking the time to read this. We think we've got a really exciting project ahead of us and we really appreciate any support you can offer to help VAU support emerging artists and make art more accessible to the public!

story:
Short Summary

Hi!
I'm Asaf and I'm a circus artist from Israel, specializing in juggling, dance and acrobatics. I've been juggling for 10 years, and over time it went from a hobby to a passion. I live, eat and breath circus, I've performed and taught workshops around the world, and I've contributed to the juggling community by sharing and teaching on youtube videos.
I've been in the Sandciel circus school for 2 years and now I've been accepted to the circus school in Bordeaux, France.

The school will give me the training I need to follow my dream of becoming a circus artist, I want to create movement-focused juggling shows that blend juggling with dance and acrobatics
I will have classes in juggling, acrobatics, dance, theater, and physical conditioning.

What I Need

  • €2500 - Tuition fee
  • €150 - Registration fee

I mainly need to cover my school fees, any money over the limit would go towards living expenses in France or funding the next year of circus school.

What I Can give you

  • €15 - I'll look at your juggling video and give you feedback on what you can improve.
  • €25 - You'll get a thank you on my next video
  • €50 - You can ask me to make a juggling tutorial on poi or clubs on a move you want to learn.
  • €1000 - A poi or juggling workshop for up to 15 people.
Feel free to suggest other perks I can offer!

The Impact

Studying circus is a dream I've been following for the last 2 years, continuing my circus education in France is an even bigger dream, that you'll be helping make a reality.

Circus school so far has helped me improve as an artist, I've developed my own unique style in juggling which combines manipulation and classic juggling with dance and acrobatics, and I want to go even deeper into finding my own style. 

Thank you so much for your help and support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by donating that's understandable, a good way to help would be to spread the word and share this on social networks.

story:
THE BOOK

Antonio Fernández (Piqui) is a member of the Cursed Monkeys Corp with a very particular view on modeling. He wants to tell little stories with his figures and vignettes. That's the reason why his works go beyond a simple figure. He had a yearning to write a book to help all hobbyists who wanted to move from being simply a painter to being a complete modeler who not only paints figures but can also fix them, make conversions, build terrain and, in the end, has got all the tools to TELL STORIES in miniature; and finally he got around to writing it. And of course, the rest of his teammates from the Cursed Monkeys Corp have contributed as much as possible.

For those who don't know us, the Cursed Monkeys Corp was born some time ago as a group of friends with a common hobby, modeling, who wanted to share their work with other people. What sets us apart from the rest is that we have a slightly different view of the hobby.

For us, the story is the heart of the hobby, so we try to create scenes which are a setting to tell something.

We started as enthusiastic hobbyists with several years of experience who wanted to go a small step beyond, building small scenes with meaning in the beginning, but now we make complex and richly detailed scenes, both big and small. We have grown ourselves, hand in hand with our work, so right now three of us work professionally in the modeling business.

In this book we all have worked under Antonio Fernandez's leadership, as contributors to the first monograph not focused solely on painting or sculpting, but on the whole creative process.

This book is for all hobbyists – painters, sculptors, modelers – who practice several aspects of the hobby. It deals with techniques from the basic, like cleaning and pinning the figure, to the advanced, like portrait sculpting. In this book, the hobbyist will find a plethora of help and advice, and also complete, step-by-step sculpting procedures illustrated with more than 500 pictures of Antonio Fernandez's (Piquifl) work, and from his teammates in the Cursed Monkeys Corp modeling group too.

And now we need your help to make it real.


Antonio Fernandez (Piqui) es un miembro mas de los The Cursed Monkeys Corp, con una visión muy particular del modelismo. El quiere contar pequeñas historias con sus figuras y escenas. Esa es la razón por la que sus obras, transmiten algo más que una simple figura. Uno de sus anhelos era escribir un libro con la intención de prestar una ayuda a todo aficionado que quiera pasar de ser un pintor a un modelista completo, que no solo pinta figuras, sino que es capaz de arreglarlas, conversionarlas, crear un terreno y, en definitiva, tiene todas las herramientas para CONTAR HISTORIAS, y por fin se animo a escribirlo. Y, por supuesto, el resto de compañeros de los Cursed Monkeys Corp, hemos colaborado en todo lo posible.

Para los que no nos conozcáis The Cursed Monkeys Corp nació hace algún tiempo como un grupo de amigos con un hobby en común, el modelismo, que pretendía compartir su trabajo con otra gente. Lo que nos hace diferentes del resto es que tenemos una visión ligeramente distinta del hobby que la habitual.

Para nosotros la historia es el núcleo del hobby así que intentamos crear escenas que sean un escenario para contar algo. Empezamos como aficionados entusiastas con varios años de experiencia que querían dar un pequeño paso más allá construyendo pequeñas escenas con significado al principio, para ahora construir escenas muy complejas y ricas en detalles tanto grandes como pequeñas.. Nosotros mismos crecimos a la par que nuestros proyectos de forma que tres de nosotros somos profesionales del sector en estos momentos.

En este libro hemos trabajado todos bajo el liderazgo de Antonio Fernández como colaboradores de su libro para crear el primer monográfico que no esta enfocado ni a pintura ni a escultura, sino al proceso creativo completo.

Este libro está dirigido a todos los aficionados, ya sean pintores, escultores, o modelistas  que practican varias facetas del hobby. En el se ha incluido desde técnicas básicas, como el proceso de limpieza y sujeción de la figura, hasta técnicas avanzadas de modelismo como la escultura de retratos. En este libro, el aficionado encontrará, multitud de consejos y ayudas, así como procesos completos y paso a paso de escultura, ilustrados con más de 500 fotografías de  procesos y trabajos de Antonio Fernández (Piquifl), y del resto del grupo "The Cursed Monkey Corp".

Ahora necesitamos vuestra ayuda para hacerlo real.

WHAT DO WE NEED?

Our goal is to have the book published, nothing else.

We have worked very hard during the last year to write the book, which is completely finished, in two different editions, Spanish and English. It will be a full-color, DIN A4 format, near 150 pages long book which will include several chapters where Antonio Fernández explains how our projects are born in his mind and go through the whole creative process.

Inside you will find brainstorming, design, concept sketching, sculpting, composition, painting, terrain, step-by-step... THE WHOLE PROCESS DESCRIBED IN DEPTH

Given that Antonio Fernández (Piqui) is the main writer, most of the chapters have been written by him, but there are contributions by:

  1. Javier González (Arsies Studio)
  2. Alex Varela (Iguazzu)
  3. Cristina Menéndez 
  4. Francisco Gil Pavón
  5. María Fernández
  6. Luis Gómez Pradal
  7. Antonio Fernández Ortíz

Although our main goal is to make the book become a reality, we want to make it even better if it's possible. Help us and we'll try to help you.

And if we don't reach our goal your contribution will be refunded, so you are not risking your money.

Nuestra meta es publicar el libro. Nada más.

Hemos trabajado muy duro a lo largo de este último año para escribir el libro, que esta completamente terminado, en dos ediciones distintas, en español y en inglés. Será un libro en formato A4 a todo color y de cerca de 150 páginas que incluirá diversos capítulos donde Antonio Fernández explica como nuestros proyectos nacen en su mente y pasan por todo el proceso creativo.

Vas a encontrar desde tormenta de ideas , diseño, abocetado conceptual, escultura, composición, pintura, terrenos, pasos a paso, etc... EL PROCESO COMPLETO DESCRITO EN PROFUNDIDAD.

Dado que el autor principal del libro es Antonio Fernández (Piqui) la mayor parte de los capitulos han sido escritos por él, pero ha contado con la participación de:

  1. Javier González (Arsies Studio)
  2. Alex Varela (Iguazzu)
  3. Cristina Menéndez
  4. Francisco Gil Pavón
  5. María Fernández
  6. Luis Gómez Pradal
  7. Antonio Fernández Ortiz

Aunque desde luego nuestro objetivo principal es hacer el libro real, queremos hacerlo aún mejor si nos es posible. Ayudanos y trataremos de ayudarte!

Y si no alcanzamos nuestra meta tu contribución será reembolsada, así que no arriesgas tu dinero.

How can you help us?

We'll be glad if you like our idea and want to purchase a book. But first let us explain our planning:

The campaign will be online from November the 20th to December the 18th. During this time we will be giving the finishing touches to the book and the goals. Allow us to insist in the fact that the book is already written in Spanish and the English edition is about to be delivered by a professional translator we have hired.

Once the campaign ends, if we reach our goal, we will begin with the final paperwork. We will contact each of you to check both shipping and billing information. It's very important for us that you give that information if you want the book to arrive home safe and sound. At this point we will ask you wich languaje do you prefer, Spanish or English.

At the same time we will contact the printing company – which is already arranged – to confirm the books. We also will buy boxes and prepare postal labels to send the parcels.

We will have the book proofs by the first fortnight of January, 2014. Once the final corrections are made, we hope to have the final version of both books by the end of January.

We will ship all orders beginning on February the 1st, so you can have it at home that very same month. So, if you still want to help. We offer you the following options:

  • I just want some stikers: Well, I think it's cool and all, but I can't pay for it, or maybe I just want to give a little help. That's fine, great, we'll send you some thank you stickers anyway :)
  • I wanna book!: We'll send you a book in your chosen language, Spanish or English, simple as that. You need to choose your country of residence among the options, because we have three shipping costs ranges: 1- Spain, 2- Europe, 3- Rest of the World

  • I want it all!: We'll send you a book in your chosen language, Spanish or English, signed by the author. Also, you will be sent all the extra goals attained during the campaign. You need to choose your country of residence among the options, because we have three shipping costs ranges: 1- Spain, 2- Europe, 3- Rest of the World

  • GREAT CONTRIBUTOR: For all those who want to give some extra support to our project, we offer a new option. They will receive, as payment for their great support, a bust from the OutWorld Miniatures range, converted and customized by Antonio Fernández so they have a unique piece to paint. Of course, we'll send you a book in your chosen language, Spanish or English, signed by the author. Also, you will be sent all the extra goals attained during the campaign. This option is limited to 4 units only. Contributors have shipping for free!

  • SUPERIOR CONTRIBUTOR: Do you want to go a little step beyond? Great! For all those who want to give some extra support to our project, we offer another option. They will receive a bust from the OutWorld Miniatures range, converted and customized by Antonio Fernández and painted by Álex Varela (Iguazzu) or Javier González (Arsies), at the contributor's choice. That way you will have an unique piece in your collection. Of course, we'll send you a book in your chosen language, Spanish or English, signed by the author. Also, you will be sent all the extra goals attained during the campaign. This option is limited to 4 units only. Contributors have shipping for free!

  • PREMIUM CONTRIBUTOR: In this last option we offer something unique and unrepeatable as acknowledgment for your support. No less tan one of the original boxarts for the Moor Wanderer or Knight of the Order of The Lion from the OutWorld Miniatures range, painted by Álex Varela (Iguazzu). Of course, we'll send you a book in your chosen language, Spanish or English, signed by the author. Also, you will be sent all the extra goals attained during the campaign. This option is limited to the two existing units only. Contributors have shipping for free!

Esteremos encantados is te gusta nuestra idea y quisieras comprar un libro.

Permitenos explicarte nuestra planificación antes de eso:

La campaña va a estar en linea desde el 20 de noviembre al 18 de diciembre. A lo largo de este tiempo vamos a estar trabajando en el aspecto final del libro y las metas. Permitidnos remarcar que el libro ya está escrito en español y durante estos días esperamos recibir la traducción al inglés por parte de un traductor profesional que ya está contratado y trabajando en ella.

Una vez termine la campaña y si hemos alcanzado nuestra meta vamos a trabajar en la documentación final. Contactaremos con todos vosotros para confirmar tanto vuestra dirección como los datos de facturación. Es muy importante para nosotros que nos aportéis estos datos para asegurarnos de que vais a recibir el libro en vuestra casa sano y salvo. En este momento te preguntaremos también que edición prefieres, en Español o en Inglés.

Al mismo tiempo contactaremos con la imprenta (que también esta precontratada) para encargar los libros. Asimismo adquiriremos las cajas para proteger el libro en los envíos y prepararemos las etiquetas postales de cada uno de vosotros.

Tendremos la prueba de imprenta a lo largo de la primera quincena de enero de 2014. Una vez aprobada o corregida esperamos tener la versión final de todos los libros la última semana de enero.

Entre el 1 y el 15 de febrero enviaremos todos vuestros pedidos de forma que podáis tenerlo en casa ese mismo mes.

De forma que si aún quieres colaborar te ofrecemos estas opciones:

  • I just want some stikers (solo quiero unas pegatinas): bueno creo que esta muy bien, pero no puedo pagarlo o simplemente quiero contribuir. Esta bien, es genial, te mandaremos unas pegatinas como agradecimiento de todas formas :)
  • I wanna book! (Quiero un libro!): Te mandaremos un libro en el lenguaje que escojas, español o inglés, tan simple como eso. Necesitas escoger entre las opciones el país donde resides dado que tenemos 3 rangos de gastos de envío: 1- para España, 2 - Para Europa o 3- Para cualquier otra parte del mundo

  • Iwant it all! (Lo quiero todo!): Te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo de la campaña. Necesitas escoger entre las opciones el país donde resides dado que tenemos 3 rangos de gastos de envío: 1- para España, 2 - Para Europa o 3- Para cualquier otra parte del mundo
  • GREAT CONTRIBUTOR (GRAN COLABORADOR): Para todos aquellos que quieran colaborar un poco mas con nuestro proyecto, ofrecemos una nueva opción en la que recibirás, en pago por tu gran apoyo, un busto de la línea OutWorld Miniatures, que será conversionado y personalizado por Antonio Fernández, de forma que tengas una pieza única para pintar. Por supuesto, te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor, y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo de la campaña. Esta opción esta limitada a tan solo 4 unidades. Los colaboradores tiene el envío gratuito! Para escoger esta opción selecciona GREAT CONTRIBUTOR en el menú lateral. Más adelante nos pondremos en contacto contigo para saber que edicón (español o inglés) prefieres

  • SUPERIOR CONTRIBUTOR (COLABORADOR SUPERIOR): ¿Quieres ir un poco mas allá? Estupendo. Para todos aquellos que quieran colaborar un poco más con nuestro proyecto, ofrecemos otra opción en la que recibirás un busto de la linea OutWorld Miniatures, conversionado y personalizado por Antonio Fernández, y pintado por ALex Varela (Iguazzu) o Javier González (Arsies) a elección del colaborador, por lo que tendrás una pieza única para tu colección. Por supuesto, te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor, y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo della campaña. Esta opción esta limitada a tan solo 4 unidades. Los colaboradores tienen el envío gratuito! Para escoger esta opción selecciona SUPERIOR CONTRIBUTOR en el menú lateral. Más adelante nos pondremos en contacto contigo para saber que edicón (español o inglés) prefieres

  • PREMIUM CONTRIBUTOR (COLABORADOR PREMIUM). En esta última opción ofrecemos algo único e irrepetible para agradecer vuestro apoyo. Y no es ni más ni menos que uno de los Boxart originales de la marca OutWorld Miniatures, de las referencias Moor Wanderer o Knight of the Lion Order, que fueron pintados por Alex Varela (Iguazzu). Por supuesto, te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor, y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo de la campaña. Esta opción esta limitada a las dos unidades existentes.Los colaboradores tiene el envío gratuito! Para escoger esta opción selecciona PREMIUM CONTRIBUTOR en el menú lateral. Más adelante nos pondremos en contacto contigo para saber que edicón (español o inglés) prefieres


Which are the risk on this campaign?

Well, obviously the biggest risk is a delay at some point, so that if something goes really wrong you may have the book in your hands by March or April. We don't think that's likely, because we have done our homework before starting this campaign and the book is already written. But the risk is always there.

Another risk is the book getting lost in the postal service. This wouldn't be our fault, but if it happens we will try our best to locate your book.

We are going to need some information for the invoices. Spanish law suggest us that both buyer and seller be identified by a unique number: DNI or CIF in Spain, VAT in Europe for companies, SSN or Company Number in the USA, TFN in Australia, Codice Fiscali in Italy, Tax Number in the UK... and of course, passport number will alwais work. If you are not confortable giving this number please not this is an optional requirement, but highly reccomended. We will ask you for this information together with your name and address when the campaign ends, because Indiegogo doesn't have an option to get them during the campaign. If somebody doesn't send us all the information by December the 31st, we'll make a refund and won't send the book.

Of course there may be a risk we haven´t thought of...

Bueno obviamente el mayor riego es el de un retraso en algún punto del calendario, de forma que si algo sale rematadamente mal tendrás el libro en tu casa en marzo o abril. no esperamos que pase algo así porque hemos hecho nuestros deberes antes de lanzar la campaña y el libro ya está escrito, pero el riesgo por supuesto existe.

Otro riesgo es que el libro se pierda en correos. Esto no es culpa nuestra pero si pasa haremos lo posible por localizar vuestro libro.

Vamos a necesitar algunos datos para completar las facturas. la ley española sugiere que tanto el vendedor como el comprador estén identificados en la factura con un número de identificación único. (DNI o CIF en España, VAT en Europa para empresas, SSN o Company Number en Estados Unidos, TFN en Australia, Codice Fiscali en Italia, Tax Number en Inglaterra, etc... o en cualquier caso, el pasaporte mismo. A pesar de que este es un requerimiento opcional, es altamente recomendable proporcionarlo) Os preguntaremos estos datos junto con vuestro nombre y dirección de envío al finalizar la campaña dado que Indiegogo no nos facilita una herramienta para recopilarlos durante la campaña. si alguno no nos envía los datos correctamente cumplimentados antes del 31 de diciembre le haremos un reembolso y no le enviaremos el libro.

Por supuesto puede existir algún riesgo en el que no hayamos pensado.


GOALS

We have planned some extra goals that will unlock if we get extra funding. Unlocked extra goals will be send to all contributors who chose the “I want it all!”, “I want it all and I want it now!”  and "Great, Superior and Premium" contributors options.

The firsts goals are:

  • 1st Goal: 6,000 €: If we reach that amounth we will produce a limited series of prints with full-color art by Maria Fernández.


  • 2nd Goal: 7,500 €: If we reach that amouth we will produce a high quality resin, 54 mm scale anatomical mannequin sculpted by Antonio Fernández.


  • 3rd Goal: 9,000 €: If we reach that amouth we will produce a limited series, HD DVD with all the Cursed Monkeys videotutorials, including three new ones not to be seen elsewhere.

  • 4th Goal: 12,500 €: If we reach that amount, we will produce a set of accessories and weapons in 54mm scale, to complement the anatomical mannequin, including an extra head, sculpted by Antonio Fernández .

  • 5th Goal: 16,000 €: If we reach that amount, we will produce a full color magazine with a Cursed Monkeys Corp gallery, including many works that are not in the book.

Tenemos planificadas algunas metas que iremos desbloqueando si conseguimos recaudar una financiación extra.

Las metas extra desbloqueadas se enviarán gratuitamente a todos aquellos que escojan la opción de colaborar "¡Lo quiero todo!", "¡Lo quiero todo! ¡Lo quiero YA!!" y los colaboradores "gran colaborador, superior y premium".

Las metas planificadas hasta ahora son:

  • PRIMETA META: 6,000 €; si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos una serie limitada de láminas con una ilustración a color de María Fernández.

  • SEGUNDA META: 7,500 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos en resina de alta calidad un maniquí anatómico escultpido por Antonio Fernández en escala 54 mm. 

  • TERCERA META: 9,000 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos una serie limitada de DVD con todos los videotutoriales de The Cursed Monkeys, en calidad HD, incluyendo tres videotutoriales exclusivos que no se difundirán de otro modo.

  • CUARTA META: 12,500 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos un set de accesorios y armas en escala 54 mm, que complementen el maniquí anatómico, incluyendo una cabeza extra, esculpido por Antonio Fernández. 


  • QUINTA META: 16,000 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos una revista a color con una galería de trabajos de todos los Monkeys Cursed Corp, incluyendo muchos trabajos que no aparecen en el libro.
story_txt:
THE BOOK

Antonio Fernández (Piqui) is a member of the Cursed Monkeys Corp with a very particular view on modeling. He wants to tell little stories with his figures and vignettes. That's the reason why his works go beyond a simple figure. He had a yearning to write a book to help all hobbyists who wanted to move from being simply a painter to being a complete modeler who not only paints figures but can also fix them, make conversions, build terrain and, in the end, has got all the tools to TELL STORIES in miniature; and finally he got around to writing it. And of course, the rest of his teammates from the Cursed Monkeys Corp have contributed as much as possible.
For those who don't know us, the Cursed Monkeys Corp was born some time ago as a group of friends with a common hobby, modeling, who wanted to share their work with other people. What sets us apart from the rest is that we have a slightly different view of the hobby.
For us, the story is the heart of the hobby, so we try to create scenes which are a setting to tell something.
We started as enthusiastic hobbyists with several years of experience who wanted to go a small step beyond, building small scenes with meaning in the beginning, but now we make complex and richly detailed scenes, both big and small. We have grown ourselves, hand in hand with our work, so right now three of us work professionally in the modeling business.
In this book we all have worked under Antonio Fernandez's leadership, as contributors to the first monograph not focused solely on painting or sculpting, but on the whole creative process.
This book is for all hobbyists – painters, sculptors, modelers – who practice several aspects of the hobby. It deals with techniques from the basic, like cleaning and pinning the figure, to the advanced, like portrait sculpting. In this book, the hobbyist will find a plethora of help and advice, and also complete, step-by-step sculpting procedures illustrated with more than 500 pictures of Antonio Fernandez's (Piquifl) work, and from his teammates in the Cursed Monkeys Corp modeling group too.
And now we need your help to make it real.

Uno de sus anhelos era escribir un libro con la intención de prestar una ayuda a todo aficionado que quiera pasar de ser un pintor a un modelista completo, que no solo pinta figuras, sino que es capaz de arreglarlas, conversionarlas, crear un terreno y, en definitiva, tiene todas las herramientas para CONTAR HISTORIAS, y por fin se animo a escribirlo. Y, por supuesto, el resto de compañeros de los Cursed Monkeys Corp, hemos colaborado en todo lo posible.

only. Contributors have shipping for free!






Esteremos encantados is te gusta nuestra idea y quisieras comprar un libro.
Permitenos explicarte nuestra planificación antes de eso:La campaña va a estar en linea desde el 20 de noviembre al 18 de diciembre. A lo largo de este tiempo vamos a estar trabajando en el aspecto final del libro y las metas. Permitidnos remarcar que el libro ya está escrito en español y durante estos días esperamos recibir la traducción al inglés por parte de un traductor profesional que ya está contratado y trabajando en ella.
Una vez termine la campaña y si hemos alcanzado nuestra meta vamos a trabajar en la documentación final. Contactaremos con todos vosotros para confirmar tanto vuestra dirección como los datos de facturación. Es muy importante para nosotros que nos aportéis estos datos para asegurarnos de que vais a recibir el libro en vuestra casa sano y salvo. En este momento te preguntaremos también que edición prefieres, en Español o en Inglés.Al mismo tiempo contactaremos con la imprenta (que también esta precontratada) para encargar los libros. Asimismo adquiriremos las cajas para proteger el libro en los envíos y prepararemos las etiquetas postales de cada uno de vosotros.
Tendremos la prueba de imprenta a lo largo de la primera quincena de enero de 2014. Una vez aprobada o corregida esperamos tener la versión final de todos los libros la última semana de enero.
Entre el 1 y el 15 de febrero enviaremos todos vuestros pedidos de forma que podáis tenerlo en casa ese mismo mes.De forma que si aún quieres colaborar te ofrecemos estas opciones:
I just want some stikers (solo quiero unas pegatinas): bueno creo que esta muy bien, pero no puedo pagarlo o simplemente quiero contribuir. Esta bien, es genial, te mandaremos unas pegatinas como agradecimiento de todas formas :)
I wanna book! (Quiero un libro!): Te mandaremos un libro en el lenguaje que escojas, español o inglés, tan simple como eso. Necesitas escoger entre las opciones el país donde resides dado que tenemos 3 rangos de gastos de envío: 1- para España, 2 - Para Europa o 3- Para cualquier otra parte del mundo

Iwant it all! (Lo quiero todo!): Te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo de la campaña. Necesitas escoger entre las opciones el país donde resides dado que tenemos 3 rangos de gastos de envío: 1- para España, 2 - Para Europa o 3- Para cualquier otra parte del mundo






GREAT CONTRIBUTOR (GRAN COLABORADOR): Para todos aquellos que quieran colaborar un poco mas con nuestro proyecto, ofrecemos una nueva opción en la que recibirás, en pago por tu gran apoyo, un busto de la línea OutWorld Miniatures, que será conversionado y personalizado por Antonio Fernández, de forma que tengas una pieza única para pintar. Por supuesto, te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor, y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo de la campaña. Esta opción esta limitada a tan solo 4 unidades. Los colaboradores tiene el envío gratuito! Para escoger esta opción selecciona GREAT CONTRIBUTOR en el menú lateral. Más adelante nos pondremos en contacto contigo para saber que edicón (español o inglés) prefieres




SUPERIOR CONTRIBUTOR (COLABORADOR SUPERIOR): ¿Quieres ir un poco mas allá? Estupendo. Para todos aquellos que quieran colaborar un poco más con nuestro proyecto, ofrecemos otra opción en la que recibirás un busto de la linea OutWorld Miniatures, conversionado y personalizado por Antonio Fernández, y pintado por ALex Varela (Iguazzu) o Javier González (Arsies) a elección del colaborador, por lo que tendrás una pieza única para tu colección. Por supuesto, te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor, y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo della campaña. Esta opción esta limitada a tan solo 4 unidades. Los colaboradores tienen el envío gratuito! Para escoger esta opción selecciona SUPERIOR CONTRIBUTOR en el menú lateral. Más adelante nos pondremos en contacto contigo para saber que edicón (español o inglés) prefieres





PREMIUM CONTRIBUTOR (COLABORADOR PREMIUM). En esta última opción ofrecemos algo único e irrepetible para agradecer vuestro apoyo. Y no es ni más ni menos que uno de los Boxart originales de la marca OutWorld Miniatures, de las referencias Moor Wanderer o Knight of the Lion Order, que fueron pintados por Alex Varela (Iguazzu). Por supuesto, te enviaremos el libro en el formato que escojas, español o inglés, firmado por el autor, y además todas las metas extras que obtengamos a lo largo de la campaña. Esta opción esta limitada a las dos unidades existentes.Los colaboradores tiene el envío gratuito! Para escoger esta opción selecciona PREMIUM CONTRIBUTOR en el menú lateral. Más adelante nos pondremos en contacto contigo para saber que edicón (español o inglés) prefieres





Which are the risk on this campaign?
Well, obviously the biggest risk is a delay at some point, so that if something goes really wrong you may have the book in your hands by March or April. We don't think that's likely, because we have done our homework before starting this campaign and the book is already written. But the risk is always there.Another risk is the book getting lost in the postal service. This wouldn't be our fault, but if it happens we will try our best to locate your book.We are going to need some information for the invoices. Spanish law suggest us that both buyer and seller be identified by a unique number: DNI or CIF in Spain, VAT in Europe for companies, SSN or Company Number in the USA, TFN in Australia, Codice Fiscali in Italy, Tax Number in the UK... and of course, passport number will alwais work. If you are not confortable giving this number please not this is an optional requirement, but highly reccomended. We will ask you for this information together with your name and address when the campaign ends, because Indiegogo doesn't have an option to get them during the campaign. If somebody doesn't send us all the information by December the 31st, we'll make a refund and won't send the book.Of course there may be a risk we haven´t thought of...
Bueno obviamente el mayor riego es el de un retraso en algún punto del calendario, de forma que si algo sale rematadamente mal tendrás el libro en tu casa en marzo o abril. no esperamos que pase algo así porque hemos hecho nuestros deberes antes de lanzar la campaña y el libro ya está escrito, pero el riesgo por supuesto existe.
Otro riesgo es que el libro se pierda en correos. Esto no es culpa nuestra pero si pasa haremos lo posible por localizar vuestro libro.
Vamos a necesitar algunos datos para completar las facturas. la ley española sugiere que tanto el vendedor como el comprador estén identificados en la factura con un número de identificación único. (DNI o CIF en España, VAT en Europa para empresas, SSN o Company Number en Estados Unidos, TFN en Australia, Codice Fiscali en Italia, Tax Number en Inglaterra, etc... o en cualquier caso, el pasaporte mismo. A pesar de que este es un requerimiento opcional, es altamente recomendable proporcionarlo) Os preguntaremos estos datos junto con vuestro nombre y dirección de envío al finalizar la campaña dado que Indiegogo no nos facilita una herramienta para recopilarlos durante la campaña. si alguno no nos envía los datos correctamente cumplimentados antes del 31 de diciembre le haremos un reembolso y no le enviaremos el libro.
Por supuesto puede existir algún riesgo en el que no hayamos pensado.
GOALS
We have planned some extra goals that will unlock if we get extra funding. Unlocked extra goals will be send to all contributors who chose the “I want it all!”, “I want it all and I want it now!”  and "Great, Superior and Premium" contributors options.The firsts goals are:

1st Goal: 6,000 €: If we reach that amounth we will produce a limited series of prints with full-color art by Maria Fernández.

2nd Goal: 7,500 €: If we reach that amouth we will produce a high quality resin, 54 mm scale anatomical mannequin sculpted by Antonio Fernández.

3rd Goal: 9,000 €: If we reach that amouth we will produce a limited series, HD DVD with all the Cursed Monkeys videotutorials, including three new ones not to be seen elsewhere.
4th Goal: 12,500 €: If we reach that amount, we will produce a set of accessories and weapons in 54mm scale, to complement the anatomical mannequin, including an extra head, sculpted by Antonio Fernández .


5th Goal: 16,000 €: If we reach that amount, we will produce a full color magazine with a Cursed Monkeys Corp gallery, including many works that are not in the book.


Tenemos planificadas algunas metas que iremos desbloqueando si conseguimos recaudar una financiación extra.Las metas extra desbloqueadas se enviarán gratuitamente a todos aquellos que escojan la opción de colaborar "¡Lo quiero todo!", "¡Lo quiero todo! ¡Lo quiero YA!!" y los colaboradores "gran colaborador, superior y premium".Las metas planificadas hasta ahora son:
PRIMETA META: 6,000 €; si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos una serie limitada de láminas con una ilustración a color de María Fernández.
SEGUNDA META: 7,500 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos en resina de alta calidad un maniquí anatómico escultpido por Antonio Fernández en escala 54 mm. 
TERCERA META: 9,000 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos una serie limitada de DVD con todos los videotutoriales de The Cursed Monkeys, en calidad HD, incluyendo tres videotutoriales exclusivos que no se difundirán de otro modo.

CUARTA META: 12,500 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos un set de accesorios y armas en escala 54 mm, que complementen el maniquí anatómico, incluyendo una cabeza extra, esculpido por Antonio Fernández. 

QUINTA META: 16,000 €; Si recaudamos esta cantidad produciremos una revista a color con una galería de trabajos de todos los Monkeys Cursed Corp, incluyendo muchos trabajos que no aparecen en el libro.

story: I put all of my financial aid money from this semester into this RV and finally have ran out. I live in an uncomfortable, unsafe environment that was once physically threatening--and i need to come up with $500 to pay off the remaining amount and then tow the RV home. I had to spend my birthday like this, i don't want to spend Christmas--or next semester like this. I am a former foster youth and have always lived in other people's spaces. this RV would give me more freedom than you can imagine.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Charles P Redwine; I am an out of work archaeologist who can no longer dig due to physical health limitations. I also have a major mental illness. I have applied for disability but that is a long process and I'm early on. I was last employed in a call center and that turned out to be a job I was unsuited to and I was fired for lack of productivity. My unemployment insurance ran out in July and church, family, and friends have done all they can for me.

I need money to pay bills including: phone, internet, water, car insurance, and gasoline. I get help from a state agency for my rent and part of my electric bill, but will need more money to cover expenses for winter heat. Also, I am requesting money to pay for some Christmas presents for family.

All the above expenses for November and December add up to the 900 dollars I am requesting. Any contribution, no matter how small would be apprciated.
